font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Ludo Rocher</span> has written\nthat the white invader injected posion into the Tamil Agama Sthala Puranas<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">\n\n</span>\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cThe scholarship on\nvarious Puranas, has suffered from frequent forgeries, &nbsp;where liberties in the transmission of Puranas\nwere normal and those who copied older manuscripts replaced words or added new\ncontent to fit the theory that the colonial scholars were keen on publishing\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br /></span></i></span></span>\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 115%;\"><br /></span></i></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">JPCSS baby SHIT-<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">QUOTE:&nbsp; The priest who conducts the puja in\nBadrinath(a) in the Himalaya is a Namputiri Brahmin from Kerala -he is called\n\"Rawal\".UNQUOTE<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">SORRY, WHEN A\nNAMBOODIRI DELEGATES HIS DUTY WHEN HE IS NOT AROUND ( LIKE WINTER IN KEDARNATH\n) , THOSE MAKE SHIFT &nbsp;PUJARIS (<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">\nINTRODUCED BY JEW ROTHSCHILD </b>) ARE CALLED RAWALS.</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/06/6000-year-old-kedarnath-temple-highest.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/06/6000-year-old-kedarnath-temple-highest.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">JPCSS STHALA PURANA\nBULL IN HIS MAGNUM OPUS ( SIC ) &nbsp;\u201cHINDU\nDHARMA \u201c \u2013<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">JPCSS baby does NOT\nknow that Shiva , Vishnu , Parvati etc are cosmic allegories.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">QUOTE: Sthala Puranas\nthat fill the gaps in the 18 main Puranas and Upa-puranas.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">Once Siva and Amba\n(Parvati) played dice in Kailasa. \"I have won the game, \" said Amba.\n\"No, I am the winner, \" said Siva. The two played thus to impart\nlessons in dharma to mankind. If now their game of dice ended in a quarrel it\nwas because the divine couple wanted the world to learn that playing for stakes\nwas an evil, that it leads to disputes and misconduct.To resume the story. In\nhis anger Siva cursed Amba thus: \"You shall be born a cow and shall keep\nroaming the earth. \" Siva is Pasupati, lord of animals. Yes, he is the\nLord that controls the animal senses(the indriyas) that are in a frenzy. It is\nto demonstrate that he does not bless people with a big ego that he cursed even\nParasakti(the Supreme Power). Though she is Mahasakti herself she realised her\nerror and, the great pativrata that she is, she became submissive to her\nhusband. She roamed the earth as an ordinary cow.In her One Thousand Names\n(\"Sahasranama\") Amba is extolled as \"Gomata, Guhajanmabhu.\n\" She came to the earth as Gomata(Mother Cow).Visnu is Amba's brother, is\nhe not? He is very much attached to her and, as soon he knew that his\nbrother-in-law(Siva) had \"driven her out\", he thought to\nhimself:\"Let him not protect her, lord of animals though he be. I will\nhave my sister under my protection. \" So taking the guise of a cowherd he\naccompanied the divine cow. He was not the victim of any curse that he should\nroam the earth thus. It was to demonstrate to the world the dharma of filial\naffection that he came down to the world of mortals with her. (He developed a\nliking for the job of the cowherd now. That is how he took delight in grazing\ncows in his incarnation as Krsna. He then came to be called Gopala which name\nalso means \"Pasupati\". If you reflect on these two names of Siva and\nVisnu you will cease to make any distinction between the two gods. )&nbsp; POISON<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">Tiru-Azhundur is the\nplace to which sister and brother came as cow and cowherd. It is the same as\n\"Terazhundur\". It also happens to be the birthplace of Kambar and in\nfact there is a locality here called \"Kambarmedu\". Tirumangai Azhvar\nperformed the \"mangala sasanam\" in a temple here. Visnu is in the\nsanctum sanctorum as Gopala with the cow. Since he came as a companion of the\ncow he is called \"Gosakha\". \"Gosakhaksetra\" is another name\nfor Terazhundur. \"Gosakha\" in Tamil is \"Amaruviyappan\", the\ninitial \"a\" in the name meaning cow. There is a temple to Siva also\nhere. According to our ancient system of town-planning there must be a temple\nto Siva at one end of a village or town and one to Visnu at the other. If the\nVisnu temple at Terazhundur is associated with the songs of the Azhvars the\nSiva temple is associated with the Tevaram hymns of Jnanasambandhar. The places\nsung by the Azvars are said to have had \"mangalasasanam\", while any\nplace associated with the Tevaram is called \"patal perra sthalam\"\n[place that has been sung]. Many places in the South have had both types of\ndistinction. Terazhundur is one of them. Near it is a village called Pillur\nwhere Visnu, as the cowherd grazed the cow that was Amba. (\"Pillur\"\nmeans a place where grass grows, pil meaning grass. In the Tanjavur region pul\nis known as pil. ) Mekkirimangalam also is one of the places where Visnu grazed\nthe cow and An-angur another(an=cow). POISON<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">One day, when the cow\n(that is Amba) was grazing, her hoof dug into the earth and a stone was\nrevealed. It proved to be a Siva linga. The cow, thinking that she had commited\nan offence against Siva, ran about in bewilderment. Visnu pacified her and\nbrought her back. The place where this incident occured is \"Tirukkulambiyam\".\nVisnu was pained by all these developments and regretted that his sister had\nshown herself to be egoistic, albeit playfully, and that this fact had led to\nsuch unfortunate consequences. POISON<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">It was Visnu who had\nmarried Minaksi to Sundaresvara. Wishing to unite them again he now performed\npuja to propitiate Siva. The latter was pleased and he said to Visnu:\n\"Keep grazing the cow until you come to the river Kaveri. Bathe her in the\nriver and she will be restored to her original form. I shall tell you later\nwhen I will marry her. \" POISON<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">Visnu, as bidden by\nSiva, bathed the cow in the Kaveri. The place where the cow was seen after she\nhad bathed in the river is \"Tiruvaduturai\". (It is also important for\nthe reason that it was here that Tirumular composed his Tirumantiram. ) POISON <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">Amba was restored to\nher original form and Siva himself appeared on the scene. But he wanted to play\na game again. There is a place called Kurralam. (It is not the same as the\nKurralam in Tirunelveli district that is famous for its waterfall. This\nKurralam is near Mayuram in Tanjavur district. It was once called Tirutturutti.\nThis is one of the 44 places which Appar, Sambandhar and Sundaramurti have\nsung. ) A sage was performing austerities here for Amba herself to be born as\nhis daughter. Siva thought that this was the opportune moment to grant his\nwish. He said to Amba: \"Go and be born the daughter of the sage at\nTirutturutti. I will come and marry you at the appropriate time. \" POISON <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">Siva made his\nappearance as promised. There is proof for the fact that the one who gave his\nword at Gosakhaksetra appeared here also in that in this place too the deity is\ncalled Vedesvara. The sage and Visnu- the latter had been waiting for the day\nhis sister would be married again to Siva- received Siva and took him to the\nplace of marriage. The spot where Siva was received came to be called\n\"Etirkolpadi\". The \"vrata\" before the marriage was\nperformed by Siva in a nearby place which later came to be called\n\"Velvikkudi\". The spot where he saw Amba as the bride and performed\nthe palika ceremony is called \"Kurumulaippali\". The marriage pandal\nwas spread over two or three villages. The one in the middle came to be called\n\"Tirumananjeri \". It was here that Visnu married Parvati to\nParamesvara and it was an occasion of great joy for him. POISON <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">From this account you\nwill realise how wrong it is to dismiss Sthala Puranas as of no significance.\nThe present story contains a warning against the evil consequences of ahamkara\nand gambling and tells us how a wife should be dutiful towards her husband and\nhow a brother should be affectionate towards, and concerned about, his sister.\nActually I did not tell the story with this idea in mind. I wished to\ndemonstrate how a number of Sthala Puranas fit into one another, how the\nincidents narrated in different Sthala Puranas are woven together- those of\nTerazhundur, Pillur, Anangur, Tirukkulambiyam, Tiruvaduturai, Kurralam,\nEtirkolpadi, Velvikkudi, Kurmulaippali and Tirumananjeri. The interconnected\nnarrative also shows that the story must be authentic. POISON <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">A story with which\npeople of Tanjavur should be more familiar links Kumbakonam with places in its\nneighbourhood.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">During the great deluge\nBrahma prepared himself for the next creation. He put all the seeds in\namrta(the elixer of immortality) and kept them together in a mudpot to the\nchanting of Vedic mantras. With due ceremony, he placed a coconut with mango\nleaves on it and invested the same with the sacred thread. Now he placed the\npot on the summit of Meru. When it came floating in the waters of the deluge,\nParamesvara wished to recommence creation. Then the coconut on the pot was\ndislodged in the storm and fell into the water. At once the water receded\nrevealing the land there. This spot is four miles north-west of Kumbhakonam.\nThe deity here is even today called \"Narikelesvara\",\n(\"narikela\" means coconut). Then the mango leaves fell off. The water\nreceded there too revealing land. This is Tiruppurambayam, four miles\nnorth-west of Kumbhakonam. \"Payam\" [or bayam] is \"payas\",\nthat is water, but in this context deluge. \"Puram\" means outside or\nbeyond something: the name of the place [Tiruppurambayam] thus means\"outside\nthe waters of the deluge\". Now the sacred thread(sutra) also got loosened\nfrom the pot and fell off. The deity in the place where the sutra fell is\n\"Sutranatha\", \"sutra\" meaning the \"sacred\nthread\". POISON<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">The kumbha(pot) had a\n\"nose\" in addition to a \"mouth\"- it was like a gindi or kamandalu.\nMy pot too has a nose in addition to its mouth. Water is filled in the pot\nthrough the mouth and poured out through the nose. The pot with the amrta was\nalso similiar. Paramesvara watched the scene. Since the pot with the elixer and\nthe seeds in it were not overturned on their own, he decided to break it with\nhis arrow so as to bring out its contents. The place where he discharged the\narrow is called \"Banapuri\"- now it is known as\n\"Vanatturai\". The deity here is \"Banapurisvara\" and the\nspot where the mouth of the pot fell in pieces is\n\"Kudavayil\"(\"Kudavasal\"). Paramesvara wanted the amrta to\nbe discharged in the sastric manner, from the nose of the pot. The place where\nthe nose broke and the elixir or ambrosia fell is holier than other places. It\nis called \"Kumbhakonam\", \"kon\"(\"konam\") meaning\nnose. In the Tevaram the place is referred to as \"Kudamukku\". Here\nthe mudpot itself came to be the linga and even today it is so. The linga is\nceremonially bathed along with a protective wear outside. \"Kumbhesvara\"\nis the name of the deity. The Mahamagham pond is the spot where the amrta first\nfell. POISON<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">Since the place is\nhallowed by the fact that it was here that the amrta fell, the Vaisnava deity\nhere, Sarngapani, is called \"Ara-amudan\" by the Azhvars. To Vaisnavas\nKumbhakonam itself is \"Kudandai\".<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">Thus there are many\nsacred places that are interconnected, which fact also confirms that the Sthala\nPuranas are authentic. Tiruvazhundur, Kumbhakonam, etc, are situated within a\nradius of four miles. There will be further confirmation of the authenticity of\nthese Puranas if we note how the places mentioned in them and which are far\napart are connected together. Ramesvaram, Vedaranyam and Pattisvaram are not\nnear one another. Ramesvaram, in Ramanathapuram district, is on the seacoast.\nVedaranyam is in a corner of Tanjavur district and is also on the seashore in\nthe taluqa of Tirutturaipundi. In the same district, but by no means close by,\nis Pattisvaram which is near Kumbhakonam. These places which are far apart are\nconnected by the same thread of a story. Would you call such a story baseless?\nPOISON<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">In all these three\nplaces there are great Siva temples and the name of the deity in each is\n\"Ramalinga\", suggesting that they are connected with Rama. That he\ninstalled lingas in these places strengthens the concept of Saiva-Vaisnava\nunity. These places have some other special features too. Of the four great\nreligious centres, known as \"car-dham\", Ramesvaram alone is in the\nSouth. POISON</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\nTEEE &nbsp;HEEEEEEEEEEEE !<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_31B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c5956483555890477752\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_31M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/09/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and.html?showComment=1474736469499#c35079218010445782\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">September 24, 2016 at 10:31 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_33MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\">BY MAKING TIBETAN BUDDHISTS MONKS SETTLE DOWN IN COORG--<br /><br />JEW ROTHSCHILD THOUGH HE COULD CONVERT SOUTH INDIA INTO BUDDHISM --LIKE HOW JNU WOULD CONVERT DELHI INTO COMMIES .</span></b><br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\">SORRY, INDIANS REJECTED BUDDHISM 3900 YEARS AGO . . . .</span></b></div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_33MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n</li>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">More JPCSS SHIT - - --IN THE\nMAGNUM OPUS ( SIC ) HINDU DHARMA <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE:&nbsp; For instance, take the Perumal of the\nSrirangam temple (Tamil Nadu). The idol is unique in the sense that it faces\nsouth. There is an explanation for this in the Sthala Purana pertaining to the\ntemple. UNQUOTE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SORRY IN SANATANA\nDHARMA ONLY DAKSHINAMURTHY FACES SOUTH<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/01/lord-shiva-as-first-guru-dakshinamurthy.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/01/lord-shiva-as-first-guru-dakshinamurthy.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rothschild\u2019s Chitpavan\nJews nay Brahmins kept the Ganesha idols facing south and the Kalasha Kumbam\nupside down sans water.&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PM Modi had tweeted\nAkshaya Tritiya greetings with Kalasha Kumbham upside down and impaled on a\npole.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/05/kalasha-symbol-of-cosmic-womb-capt-ajit.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/05/kalasha-symbol-of-cosmic-womb-capt-ajit.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yet more JPCSS bullshit\nfrom his magnum Opus ( sic ) book , the bible of Hindus HINDU DHARMA <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">QUOTE -- This is why in\nsome temples Visnu is represented as a worshipper of Siva and in some other\nshrines Siva is seen as a devotee of Visnu. The same with other deities.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Tirukandiyur is in\nTanjavur district, Tamil Nadu. In the temple here Siva is seen to be a lesser\ngod than Visnu. He once plucked off one of Brahma's heads, became thus the\nvictim of a curse and was freed from it through the grace of Visnu. In the same\ndistrict is Tiruvizhimalai where it is Visnu who is seen to be a lesser god\nthan Siva. Reciting the \"Siva-Sahasranama\"(The One Thousand Names of\nSiva), Visnu offers lotuses at the feet of Siva. When he is nearing the end of his\nworship he finds that he is short of one lotus. What does he do now? Visnu, the\nlotus-eyed, digs out one of his own eyes and offers it at the feet of Siva. The\nlatter is pleased and gives him the cakra or discus. Siva is called &nbsp;here \"Netrarpanesvara\" (Siva to whom\nan eye has been offered); at Tiruakandiyur Visnu is\n\"Hara-sapa-vimocana\"(one who freed Siva from a curse). When we listen\nto the story of Tirukandiyur we learn that Visnu is a god of great compassion\nwho frees his devotees from the most terrible of curses. Similarly, from the\nTiruvizhimalai story we realise that no sacrifice is too great for a devotee-\nVisnu offers one of his own eyes to the god he worships, that is Siva. The\nquestion here is not who is the greater of the two, Siva or Visnu.&nbsp; UNQUOTE</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">POISON TO MAKE HINDUS\nFIGHT. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;BRAHMA, VISHNU ARE SHIVA ARE COSMIC\nALLEGORIES&nbsp; WHO WORK AS A HARMONIOUS TRINITY\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/09/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/09/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">More JPCSS shit<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">QUOTE : The Tamil\nPeriyapuranam tells the story of the 63 Saiva saints called Nayanmars. The same\nis available in the Sanskrit as Upamanyu Bhaktavilasa. Bhakta-Vijaya deals with\npoet-saints like Tukaram and Namadeva who were specially devoted to the deity\nPanduranga of Pandharpur.&nbsp; UNQUOTE</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tukaram and Namadeva\ndid NOT exist. , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WE HINDUS ARE ALL\nSTUPID MONKEYS, RIGHT ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They have injected\npoison in many ways -- when Yajnavalkya vomited out his knowledge , other\ndisciples ate the vomit like absorbed it like Tittiri birds and hence the\nbranch that came from those disciples is called Tittiriya sakha. . The white\nhistorian wrote that Adi shankaracharya ( actually born 4000 years ago\u2014but\nkicked forward in time by 2800 years ) followed the Taittiriya Shakha.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ALL BULL..ALL FIRST\nCLASS WHITE KOSHER LIES - - -<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Yajurveda has been\nsplit into white and black and the shattered into splinters again \u2013 and\ndifferent parts of India follow different systems\u2014all part of a GRAND DIVIDE AND\nRULE.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For example the Krishna\n( black ) Yajurveda has many parts followed by various parts of India. The FAKE\nmutts have assisted in this.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Example?- There are\nfour recensions of the Krishna Yajurveda:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Taittiriya sa\u1e43hita--\noriginally of Panchala<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maitrayani sa\u1e43hita-\noriginally of the area south of Kurukshetra<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Caraka-Ka\u1e6dha sa\u1e43hita --\noriginally of Madra and Kurukshetra<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kapi\u1e63\u1e6dhala-Ka\u1e6dha sa\u1e43hita--\nof the southern Punjab and Bahika<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The white invader gave\nbull that Lord Rama\u2019s clan follows the Shukla Yajurveda branch\u2014to DRIVE A WEDGE\nbetween Krishna/ Rama followers..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Vajasaneyi Samhita\n( Shulka Yajurveda \u2013white ) has forty chapters or adhyayas, containing the\nformulas used with the following rituals:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1.-2.: New and Full\nMoon sacrifices<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3.: Agnihotra<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4.-8.: Somayajna<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">9.-10.: Vajapeya and\nRajasuya, two modifications of the Soma sacrifice<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">11.-18.: construction\nof altars and hearths, especially the Agnicayana<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">19.-21.: Sautramani, a\nritual originally counteracting the effects of excessive Soma-drinking<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">22.-25.: Ashvamedha (\npoison injected with queens having sex with a dead horse\u2019s phallus )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">26.-29.: supplementary\nformulas for various rituals<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">30.-31.: Purushamedha<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">32.-34.: Sarvamedha<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">35.: Pitriyajna<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">36.-39.: Pravargya<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">40.: the final adhyaya\nis the famous Isha Upanishad.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Shukla Yajurveda\nhas two branches: Vajasaneyi Madhyandiniya &amp; Vajasaneyi Kanva.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vajasaneyi\nMadhyandiniya is originally of Mithila and Vajasaneyi Kanva is of originally\nKosala.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sri Shukla Yajur Veda\noriginally had 15 Sakhas out of which only two Sakhas or branches, called\nMadyandina and Kanva Sakhas are available at present .&nbsp;&nbsp; The Vedic rituals of the Ranganathaswamy\nTemple at Srirangam, the second biggest temple in India, are performed\naccording to the Kanva shakha ( Shulka ) .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Madyandina Saha was\nused by the north India fake mutts while Kanva Sakha is used in South India\u2019s\nFAKE mutts. Today even Zakir Naik quotes from Yajur Veda to ridicule Hindus.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Adi Shankaracharya had\ntaken the original YAJUR VEDA from the Kerala namboodiris and deposited it in\nthe librarby of the original Sringeri Mutt 4000 years ago--.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The North India ( white\n) versus South India ( black ) divide by an immoral DIVIDE introduced by the\nwhite invader.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They even made\nYagnavalkya , an avatar of Vishnu.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BRAAAAAAYYYY !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So what are the\nsplinter groups?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Madhyandina Yajurveda:\nfor North India- Pakistan, Uttar Pradesh, Haryana, Punjab, Bihar, Madhya\nPradesh, Rajasthan, Gujarat , Maharashtra ,, West Bengal, Assam, Nepal. This\nbranch includes Madhyandina Samhita, Madhyandina Shatapatha Brahmana, Ishavasya\nUpanishad and Brihadaranyaka Upanishad.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kanva Yajurveda: for\nNepal, HP, Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu, and Andhra Pradesh. Orissa party has a\ndifferent text.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Charaka Yajurveda: for\nMaharashtra, adjacent parts of Madhya Pradesh, Assam, Gujarat, Uttar Pradesh.\nThey now follow Maitrayani YV shakha, as the white invader took texts away .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maitrayani Yajurveda:\nfor Gujarat, Maharashtra and Rajasthan<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kathaka Yajurveda:\nKashmir, Punjab and HP<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Charayaniya Katha\nYajurveda: for Kashmir.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kapisthala Katha\nYajurveda: for Punjab and, Gujarat.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jabala Yajurveda:\nMaharashra and Gujarat<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Taittiriya Yajurveda:\nSouth India . The Taittiriyas are splintered into numerous sub-schools.\nBaudhayana and Apastamba were found all over South India , Hiranyakeshins in\nKonkan and Western Maharashtra. The Vaikhanasas around Tirupati and Chennai.\nThe Vadhulas in Kerala and Tamil Nadu. The Agniveshyas, in Kerala and Tamil\nNadu<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kauthuma Shukla\nYajurveda: Gujarat, Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu , Kerala, Karnataka, Uttar Pradesh,\nBihar, West Bengal (tradition has been revived recently).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ranayaniya Shukla\nYajurveda: Orissa, Maharashtra, Karnataka ,Uttar Pradesh and Rajasthan.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jaiminiya/Talavakara\nShukla Yajurveda: Kerala and Tamil Nadu Brahmins.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shatyayaniya Shukla\nYajurveda: Tamil Nadu.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gautama Shukla\nYajurveda: Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bhallavi Shukla\nYajurveda: Karnataka.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Other Shakhas of\nYajurveda: A text called 'Yajurvedavriksha' gives the geographical distribution\nof more than 100 Shakhas of Yajurveda.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE FAKE MUTTS OF\nROTHSCHILD HAD A MERRY TIME.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The white invader even\nintroduces different pronounciations \u2013 for example the North Indian Brahmins\npronounce the syllable </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0937</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"> as </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0916</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The white invader\nintroduces difference in TIME.&nbsp;&nbsp; The\nShukla Yajurvedis are classified into two groups called the Madhyandins and the\nKanavas.&nbsp;&nbsp; These IDIOTS perform Sandhya\nVandana at noon.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Well, I am getting\ncynical and this is NO good.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Generally the Krishna\nYajurveda includes the Brahmana prose discussions mixed within the Samhita,\nwhile the Shukla Yajurveda has separately a Brahmana text, the Shatapatha\nBrahmana.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shukla Yajurveda is\nalso known as Vajasaneya Yajurveda, because it was evolved in great rapidity by\nSun who was in the form of a horse through his manes .&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The rhythm of recital\nof these vedas is set to the rhythm of the horse gallop . In Sanskrit, term\n\"Vaji\" means horse. Yajnavalkya divided s Vajasaneya Yajurveda again\ninto fifteen branches, each branch comprising hundreds of Yajus Mantras.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to the\nMahabhasya of Patanjali, there were 21 shakhas of Rigveda, 9 of Atharvaveda,\n101 of Yajurveda , and 1000 varieties of chanting of Samaveda.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Only 20 or so Shakhas of the Vedas are\nextant now, we do possess names of most of the lost Shakhas of the Rigveda,\nYajurveda and Atharvaveda.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fragments of many of\nthe lost shakhas are also available as quotations in ancient works. For the\nSamaveda, we do not have more than 40 names extant.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Imagine the damage done\nby the VULGAR white invader to Hinduism.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lopamudra\u2019s hymn,\nasking for Agastya Rishi\u2019s&nbsp; attention and\nsexual love is total FAKE. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We in Kerala know\nbetter as Maharishi Agastya's first disciple Thirayar Rishi&nbsp; is the patron of the THIYYA community of\nKerala who ruled Kerala , till Rothchild came and introduced crypto Jew rulers\nand demoted THIYYAS .&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; DNA tests will\nNOT lie.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Similarly FAKE Ghosha\u2019s\nFAKE Rig Veda Sukta 40 is utter nonsense. Rig Veda was not CREATED it was seen\nby seers . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No seer will SEE this\nsukta below\u2014 even a idiot can figure this out.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201c&nbsp; Where are you, Asvins, in the evening, where\nat morn? Where is your halting place, where rest ye for the night? O Heroes,\nthis I beg of you. 'Be near me in the day, be near me in the night'.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Seers saw that stupid\nverse above ?&nbsp;&nbsp; Oh yeah ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">More JPCSS bull-<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">QUOTE:&nbsp; Yajnavalkya did so and went to the sun god\nfor refuge. The latter taught him a new Vedas, an addition to the scripture\nthat is endless. That is how we came to have Vajasaneyi or Sukla-Yajurveda. The\nother Yajurveda already taught by Vaisampayana acquired the apellation of\n\"Krsna\", so \"Krsna-Yajurveda\"&nbsp; &nbsp;UNQUOTE</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SORRY,&nbsp; WE ARE NOT GRATEFUL TO ANY WHITE MAN , WHO\nHAVE INJECTED POISON INTO OUR SCRIPTURES TO MAKE US LOOK LIKE STUPID MONKEYS. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THEY HAVE STOLEN OUR ANCIENT KNOWLEDGE, &nbsp;PATENTED IT IN THEIR OWN NAMES AND THEN\nDESTROYED THE ORIGINALS.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">JPCSS lies \u2014 from his\nMagnum Opus ( sic ) HINDU DHARMA \u2013page 149<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">UNQUOTE: These\nforeigners discovered Vedic and Vedantic texts from various parts of the\ncountry. They translated the dharma-, grhya- and srauta - sutras. The Kundalini\nTantra gained importance only after Arthur Avalon had written extensively on\nit. A number of Westerns have contributed studies of other aspects of our\nculture also. It was because of the Protection of Ancient Monuments Act that\ncame into force during the viceroyalty of Lord Curzon that our temples and\nother monuments were saved from vandals. Fergusson took photographs of our\nartistic treasures (sculptures) and made them known to the world. Men like\nCunningham, Sir John Marshall and Mortimer -Wheeler did notable work in Indian\narchaelogy. It was because of the labours of Mackenizie who gathered\nmanuscripts from various parts of India that we come to know about many of our sastras.\nThe department of epigraphy was started during British rule..UNQUOTE </span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SORRY,&nbsp; THE WHITE INVADER MURDERED INDIAN HISTORY TO\nMAKE US SELF LOATHING AND TO FEEL INFERIOR. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">TODAY ASHOKA IS ON OUR\nEMBLEM, CURRENCY, FLAG ETC . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THIS FELLOW &nbsp;ASHOKA WHO CONVERTED FROM BAAAD BAAAAAD\nHINDUISM TO GOOODY GOOOOD BUDDHISM&nbsp; NEVER\nEXISTED.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">QUOTE: &nbsp;Also they have carried out research into how\ncertain words used in the Vedas are seen in a different form in the Ramayana,\nthe Mahabharata and the works of poets like Kalidasa. UNQUOTE</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SORRY,&nbsp; KALIDASA WAS A FAKE AND BACK DATED CREATION\nOF JEW ROTHSCHILD.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">JPCSS lies \u2014 from his\nMagnum Opus ( sic ) HINDU DHARMA \u2013page 159<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">QUOTE: . A professor\ntold me that the Theory of Relativity occurred to Einstein in a flash, that he\nknew it intuitively. If we accept such claims, how can we dismiss the belief\nthat Vedas are not the work of mortals :UNQUOTE</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">HEY JPCSS ---WHO TOLD\nYOU ALL THIS ? &nbsp;&nbsp;EINSTEIN WAS A THIEF.&nbsp; &nbsp;HIS\nENTIRE WORK IS LIFTED FROM THE VEDAS</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/08/yellapragada-subbarow-nobel-prize-and.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/08/yellapragada-subbarow-nobel-prize-and.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">JPCSS lies \u2014 from his\nMagnum Opus ( sic ) HINDU DHARMA \u2013page 172<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">QUOTE: . Sankara, who\nhas expounded the ideals of Self-realisation and jnana, says: \"Vedo nityam\nadhiyatam taduditam karma svanusthiyatam\" (Chant the vedas every day.\nPerform with care the sacrifices and other rites they enjoin upon you). The\nAcharya wants us to conduct sacrifices not for happiness in this world, nor for\nthe enjoyment of the pleasure of paradise UNQUOTE</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SORRY,&nbsp; THERE &nbsp;IS NO BLOOD SACRIFICE IN SANATANA DHARMA.&nbsp; &nbsp;ONLY\nGHEE IS \u201cSACRIFICED \u201c IN A YAGNA ( HOMAM )&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">JPCSS lies \u2014 from his\nMagnum Opus ( sic ) HINDU DHARMA \u2013page 182<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">QUOTE: Vyasa goes on to\nstate in his Brahmasutra that animal sacrifice is not sinful since the act is\npermeated by the sound of the Vedas. What is pure or impure is to be known by\nthe authority provided by the Vedas or rather their sound called Sabdapramana.\nIf sacrifices were impure acts according to the Vedas, they would not have\naccepted them as part of the Atmic quest.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">According to Manu\nhimself conducting one asvamedha (horse sacrifice) is superior to performing a\nthousand other sacrifices.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">In the concluding\npassage of the Chandogya Upanishad whwre ahimsa or non-violence is extolled you\nfind these words, \"Anyatra tirthebhyah\". It means ahimsa must be\npractised except with regard to Vedic rites.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">It is only from the\nsixth haviryajna onwards (it is called \"nirudhapasubandha\") that\nanimals are sacrificed.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">\"Brahmins\nsacrificed herds and herds of animals and gorged themselves on their meat. The\nBuddha saved such herds when they were being taken to the sacrificial altar,\n\" we often read such accounts in books. To tell the truth, there is no\nsacrifice in which a large number of animals are killed. For vajapeya which is\nthe highest type of yajna performed by Brahmins, only twenty-three animals are\nmentioned. For asvamedha (horse sacrifice), the biggest of the sacrifices\nconducted by imperial rulers, one hundred animals are mentioned.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">It is totally false to\nstate that Brahmins performed sacrifices only to satisfy their appetite for\nmeat and that the talk of pleasing the deities was only a pretext. There are\nrules regarding the meat to be carved out from a sacrificial animal, the part\nof the body from which it is to be taken and the quantity each rtvik can\npartake of as prasada (idavatarana) :UNQUOTE<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">DAMN &nbsp;LIES !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/11/all-animal-sacrifices-in-hindu-temples.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2014/11/all-animal-sacrifices-in-hindu-temples.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">JPCSS lies \u2014 from his\nMagnum Opus ( sic ) HINDU DHARMA \u2013page 367<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">QUOTE:&nbsp; When Brahma's life comes to an end the\nBrahman alone will remain and there will be no cosmos. Then another Brahma will\nstart creation all over again. <span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">It is believed that Hanuman will be the next\nBrahma. </span>UNQUOTE</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; The story\ngoes that Sankara approached Mandanamisra for a philosophical disputation\nduring a sraddha performed by the latter. Vyasa and Jaimini were the two\nBrahmins to take part in the ceremony. UNQUOTE</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">HEY JPCSS BABY, &nbsp;DID THE <span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b>NAKED WIVES OF THE SAPT RISHIS</b></span> ALSO\nCOME ALONG WITH VYASA AND JAIMINI IN 820 AD ? &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BATAO NAAH !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: magenta;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: magenta;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">JPCSS lies \u2014 from his\nMagnum Opus ( sic ) HINDU DHARMA \u2013page 433<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">QUOTE: The Vedas urge\nus to speak the truth (\"Satyam vada\"). How one becomes exalted by\nremaining truthful at all costs is illustrated by the story of Hariscandra\nUNQUOTE</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">VISHVAMITRA WAS A KING (\nOF KSHATRIYA VARNA ) YET HE BECAME A MAHARISHI<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PARASHURAMA AND\nDRONACHARYA WERE BRAHMINS. 6000 YEARS AGO, &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">DRONACHARYA LED THE KAURAVAS IN BATTLE AFTER\nTHE DEATH OF BHISHMA.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PARASHURAMA WAS A\nBRAHMIN , HE CONSECRATED SABARIMALA IDOL . &nbsp;YET HE WAS A FIERCE WARRIOR WHO WAS A KALARI\nGURIKKAL IN KERALA.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-UpTTqGOHIkA/V-gZe0v6DuI/AAAAAAABMFY/IDUvwZa1yTgi5ctAz7epqxiHfqNXPouCgCLcB/s1600/bhishma_by_molee-d6o4A6o7.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\">Duryodhana consulted\nKarna after Bhishma fell in war.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\">DURYODHANA and Karna\nheld counsel as to who should be put in supreme command of the forces.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\">\"Well, everyone of\nthese princely warriors fighting on your side is great enough to be put in\ncharge of our forces as supreme commander,\" said Karna.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\">\"All these kings\nare of equal prowess, strength, energy, skill, courage, valor, ancestry and\nwisdom. They cannot all be put in joint command and, if any of them be chosen,\neach of the others would feel hurt and may not put forth his whole strength in\nthe cause. Thereby we stand to suffer. So, my advice is that we install\nDronacharya, the teacher of all these princes and warriors, as supreme\ncommander. He indeed is the greatest of all those that carry arms today. No\nkshatriya equals him in the qualities required for leading our army. Let us\ntherefore install him.\"<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\">Duryodhana agreed that\nthis was the right thing to do, and so it was decided.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\">Duryodhana went to\nDronacharya and, in the presence of the assembled warriors and princes, bowed\nand addressed him:<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\">\"Revered Master,\nyou are unrivalled among all those assembled here in caste, ancestry, knowledge\nof sciences, age, wisdom, valor and skill. I beg of you to accept the supreme\ncommand. Under your command, this army will be victorious.\" The assembled\nkings received this proposal with loud cheers and war cries that gladdened\nDuryodhana's heart.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple;\">Drona was installed in\ndue form amidst thunderous acclamation. The praise of courtiers and the sound\nof trumpets that accompanied the ceremony, made the Kauravas feel as though\nthey had already vanquished the enemy. So great was their enthusiasm and\nconfidence in Drona's leadership.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/11/mahabharata-and-bhagawat-gita-4000-bc.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/11/mahabharata-and-bhagawat-gita-4000-bc.html</a><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; font-size: large;\">LORD KRISHNA HAD THE UNWRITTEN TASK OF KILLING ALL TEST TUBE BABIES .</span></b><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/09/ethics-of-human-cloning-decided-6000.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/09/ethics-of-human-cloning-decided-6000.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both;
