Ajit Vadakayil<br />December 29, 2017 at 5:18 AM<br /><br />BEFORE THE WHITE INVADER CAME TO INDIA--<br /><br />FULL MOON DAY ( POORNIMA ) AND THREE DAYS FOLLOWING IT..<br /><br />AND ..<br /><br />NEW MOON DAY ( AMAVASYA ) -- AND THREE DAYS FOLLOWING IT..<br /><br />WERE HOLIDAYS --FOR FASTING ..<br /><br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/10/amavasya-poornima-ekadashi-fasting.html<br /><br />SIX FIXED HOLIDAYS IN A MONTH\u2026<br /><br />IF YOU DO THIS TODAY IN MODERN TIMES--AND EAT ORGANIC FOOD , YOU WILL NOT GET CANCER..<br /><br />WHEN THE EVIL WHITE INVADER-- BASTARD-- CAME TO INDIA-- HE MADE US WORSE THAN MONKEYS BY MAKING US FAST ON WRONG MEANINGLESS DATES ..<br /><br />BY 1947 JEW ROTHSCHILD CREATED HUNDREDS OF FAKE MUTTS IN INDIA. \u2026 HE MADE THE PONTIFFS OF THE 4 ORIGINAL MUTTS CRYPTO JEWS WITH PALE EYES --STOPPING THE 4000 YEAR OLD TRADITION OK KERALA NAMBOODIRIS HEADING THE 4 ORIGINAL MUTTS ..<br /><br />THE POST ABOVE IS THE REPEAT THE MOST IMPORTANT FOR 1.1 BILLION HINDUS ON THIS PLANET..<br /><br />SPRING TIDES ARE STRONGEST THREE DAYS-- REPEAT ---THREE DAYS AFTER FULL MOON AND NEW MOON..<br /><br />Tides are long-period waves that roll around the planet as the ocean is \"pulled\" back and forth by the gravitational pull of the moon and the sun as these bodies interact with the Earth in their monthly and yearly orbits\u2026<br /><br />During full or new moons\u2014which occur when the Earth, sun, and moon are nearly in alignment\u2014average tidal ranges are slightly larger. ..This occurs twice each month. ..<br /><br />The moon appears new (dark) when it is directly between the Earth and the sun. The moon appears full when the Earth is between the moon and the sun. In both cases, the gravitational pull of the sun is \"added\" to the gravitational pull of the moon on Earth, causing the oceans to bulge a bit more than usual. This means that high tides are a little higher and low tides are a little lower than average.<br /><br />Spring tides, has nothing to do with the season of spring. Rather, the term is derived from the concept of the tide \"springing forth.\" ..<br /><br />Spring tides occur twice each lunar month all year long, without regard to the season\u2026.<br /><br />http://tides.mobilegeographics.com/calendar/month/547.html<br /><br />IN THE LINK ABOVE YOU CAN SEE THAT FULL MOON IS ON 3RD DEC 2017..<br /><br />THREE DAYS LATER THE DATE IS 6TH DEC..<br /><br />THE HIGH TIDE ( SPRING ) IS 12.5 METRES --THE HIGHEST..<br /><br />JEW ROTHSCHILD TOOK AWAY INDIANS TO WORK AS INDENTURED LABOUR.. HE CUT THEM OFF CULTURALLY FROM INDIA BY INTRODUCING FAKE FESTIVALS AT FAKE DATES ..<br /><br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/04/indentured-coolie-slavery-reinvented.html<br /><br />IF CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL WAS NOT BORN ON THIS PLANET..-- HINDUS WOULD HAVE NEVER EVER KNOW ABOUT THIS HUMONGOUS DECEIT\u2026 THIS IS WHY I STARTED THIS BLOGSITE ..<br /><br />HUMAN BODY AND BRAIN IS FULL OF WATER --AND SPRING TIDES AFFECT US..<br /><br />Water covers 70 percent of Earth\u2019s surface, makes up 66% of the human body. Brain is 83% water, blood-92%, kidneys - 82%, liver-69% , muscles-75%, bones-28%...<br /><br />In my language Malayalam and in Sanskrit Kapha, Pitta and Vata means the same. Kapha is mucous , Pitta is bile and Vata means vayu or fart ( flatulence ). ..<br /><br />WHEN YOU FAST YOU BALANCE THE TRI DOSHAS..<br /><br />Most Hindus observe fast on Purnima and Amavasya. ..<br /><br />People who fast SERIOUSLY continue till the third day when the water pull/ push in human cells is highest . ..<br /><br />These three days Hindus fast or take light veggie food rich in Magnesium\u2026<br /><br />Fasting is done to reduce the acidic content in our system and to slow down the metabolic rates\u2026 This restores the body and mind balance. ..Meditation helps in centering your body, mind and soul\u2026<br /><br />CONTINUED TO 2\u2014</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_141BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; text-decoration-line: none;\">December 29, 2017 at 5:32 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_139MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nIt is better NOT to use energy for digestion during this particular 24 hours\u2026The high energy of the full moon gives the body a chance to do deep cleansing\u2026<br /><br />During the Amavasya / Poornima there are many more negative ions in the atmosphere, which is good for neutralizing free radicals \u2026 Body cells get a deep cleanse..<br /><br />At my home i have a water fall for NEGATIVE IONS..<br /><br />The Nemi lake is a VOLCANIC CRATER and it produces humongous negative ions..<br /><br />The 4 electrolytes \u2013 sodium, potassium, calcium and magnesium \u2013 form a kind of dance over 24 hrs called the day-night shift. ..Magnesium and potassium live normally within the cell, and sodium and calcium are found outside. ..<br /><br />During the day sodium invades the cell, taking a hydrogen ion with it, which is acidifying\u2026 In order to buffer this acidity, which is toxic to the cell, calcium also moves in. ..This has the effect of displacing potassium and magnesium which is shoved out of the cell\u2026<br /><br />At night due to the effect of the moon, the opposite takes place and potassium and magnesium move back into the cell, pushing out the calcium and sodium, which takes the hydrogen ion with it\u2026<br /><br />WHEN I TRIED TO WRITE A KARVA CHAUTH POST ON THIS CHUTNEY MARYs ATTACKED ME\u2026<br /><br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/10/karva-chauth-synchronising-fertility.html<br /><br />THE POST ABOVE IS THE SECOND HIGHEST READ ARTICLE ON THIS PLANET TODAY--THE FIRST BEING SURYA NAMASSKAR --96% BY FOREIGNERS..<br /><br />This has the effect of cleansing the cell, so you should wake up bright and refreshed. When the body is not cleansing properly, this process is impaired and instead you wake up tired and lethargic . There is a higher sodium content in the cell, therefore a higher hydrogen (acidifying) content, and as water follows sodium in the body, the water content of the cell starts to swell. ..<br /><br />So the cell is under pressure from high acidity \u2013 so it pulls in more calcium, which displaces more magnesium causing an imbalance\u2026<br /><br />The moon-pull is much gentler than the sun-push. Only if conditions are right within the body can the moon pull the sodium back across the cell membrane, thus making way for the Magnesium to exert a gentle push with the potassium, so that they go back to their rightful position, which is inside the cell\u2026<br /><br />What is lymph? Ayurveda knew it 6000 years ago, while modern science knew about it just 60 years back\u2026<br /><br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/08/yoga-and-ayurvedic-massage-for-draining.html<br /><br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/01/lymph-nodes-vs-endocrine-exocrine.html<br /><br />6200 YEAR OLD Ayurveda was the first to write about AUTOPHAGY.. literally SELF EATING -- it\u2019s the body\u2019s system of cleaning house: Your cells create membranes that hunt out scraps of dead, diseased, or worn-out cells; gobble them up; strip them for parts; and use the resulting molecules for energy or to make new cell parts.<br /><br />Autophagy makes us more efficient machines to get rid of faulty parts, stop cancerous growths, and stop metabolic dysfunction like obesity and diabetes.. the process plays a hand in controlling inflammation and immunity.<br /><br />THE MOST IMPORTANT EFFECT IS THAT THE BRAIN GETS SHARPENED AND THE AGEING PROCESS SLOWS DOWN<br /><br />https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=10jNZleNH9w<br /><br />FROM NOW ON HINDUS WILL CREATE THEIR OWN DESTINY--WE DONT CARE FOR THE WHITE MEN WHO FOOLED US USING AGENTS LIKE GANDHI AND BR AMBEDKAR\u2026<br /><br />Capt ajit vadakayil<br />..</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_139MN\" kind=\"m\"></span></div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_139B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 8px;\"><div>\n<br /></div>\n</li>\n</ol>\n</div>\n</span></div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_202B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; border-bottom: 0px; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;, times, freeserif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><br /></li>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/6PDsZzwCj3o/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/6PDsZzwCj3o?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-0nm1hyA7bUo/V-DvIeyoIUI/AAAAAAABL_Q/IidaJvd1aEUkAD6I08g1ipF9h0x3q59kQCLcB/s1600/aaaaa.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-0nm1hyA7bUo/V-DvIeyoIUI/AAAAAAABL_Q/IidaJvd1aEUkAD6I08g1ipF9h0x3q59kQCLcB/s640/aaaaa.jpg\" width=\"323\" /></a></div>\n<br />\nCAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL<br />\n..</div>\n", "author": {"id": "14410812789424637654", "displayName": "Capt. Ajit Vadakayil", "url": "https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654", "image": {"url": "//4.bp.blogspot.com/-QSnd-Z8F7Kc/XFtPudWdwlI/AAAAAAABfq4/vxrkFOO7Iu8Mf6-OaPgw6FPpRDSmMgLdgCK4BGAYYCw/s35/capt%25252BajitC%25252Bvadakayil.JPG"}}, "replies": {"totalItems": "182", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/435980489874829046/comments"}}, {"kind": "blogger#post", "id": "6422994269482285687", "blog": {"id": "3564735312144269387"}, "published": "2016-09-17T22:55:00+05:30", "updated": "2016-09-20T12:34:53+05:30", "etag": "\"iHf3yWDE_geBgZ8U7rgZ_xuTeAQ/dGltZXN0YW1wOiAxNDc0MzU1MDkzODEwCm9mZnNldDogMTk4MDAwMDAK\"", "url": "http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/09/marathon-running-secrets-of_17.html", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/6422994269482285687", "title": "MARATHON RUNNING , SECRETS OF ELECTROLYTES AND PERSONALISED DRINKS , part 3 \u2013 CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL", "content": "<div dir=\"ltr\" style=\"text-align: left;\" trbidi=\"on\">\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>THIS POST IS CONTINUED FROM PART 2 &nbsp;BELOW--</b></span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/09/marathon-running-secrets-of_16.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/09/marathon-running-secrets-of_16.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Although they are both\nrunning sports the 100-meter sprint and the marathon are two completely\ndifferent events. The 100-meter sprint is a brief, explosive event, &nbsp;the marathon is a prolonged, high-intensity,\nendurance event &nbsp;&nbsp;. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The essence of the\n100-meter sprint is speed, with little oxygen breathed in during its 10-second\nduration, making the event almost entirely anaerobic &nbsp;whereas, although completed by elite marathon\nrunners at a pace between 80-85% of their maximal capacity and the anaerobic\nsystem being utilized during sprint efforts in or at the end of the race, the\nmarathon is a primarily aerobic event completed in 2 to 2.5 hours by elite\nmarathon runners .</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For the body to perform\nexercise for any given intensity or duration it requires energy. Energy is\nprovided chemically in the form of Adenosine Triphosphate (ATP), a high-energy\nphosphate stored within skeletal muscle.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lipid stores in the\nbody are almost 35 times that of carbohydrate stores. They are also stored\n'dry' whereas carbohydrates are stored 'wet' (i.e. carbohydrates store 3 grams\nof water for every gram of glycogen; lipids are hydrophobic). Therefore lipids\n(i.e. fats) become the primary energy fuel during the marathon once\ncarbohydrate (i.e. glycogen) stores are depleted .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ATP is composed of a\nbase (adenosine), a sugar (ribose) and three phosphate groups. The chemical\nbonds between the phosphate groups contain the energy stored in this molecule,\nand it is the breaking of these bonds (as ATP is converted into ADP or\nadenosine diphosphate) that provides the energy to power muscle contractions\nand other cellular functions.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ATP provides the energy\nfor muscle contraction. The three mechanisms for ATP regeneration are creatine\nphosphate, anaerobic glycolysis, and aerobic metabolism. Creatine phosphate\nprovides about the first 15 seconds of ATP at the beginning of muscle contraction.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Anaerobic glycolysis produces small amounts of ATP in the absence of oxygen for\na short period. Aerobic metabolism utilizes oxygen to produce much more ATP,\nallowing a muscle to work for longer periods.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Muscle fatigue, which has many\ncontributing factors, occurs when muscle can no longer contract. An oxygen debt\nis created as a result of muscle use.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The three types of muscle fiber are slow\noxidative (SO), fast oxidative (FO) and fast glycolytic (FG). SO fibers use\naerobic metabolism to produce low power contractions over long periods and are\nslow to fatigue.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">FO fibers use aerobic metabolism to produce ATP but produce\nhigher tension contractions than SO fibers. FG fibers use anaerobic metabolism\nto produce powerful, high-tension contractions but fatigue quickly.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Let\u2019s now differentiate\naerobic vs. anaerobic and the differences with each system. Both produce adenosine-5\u2032-triphosphate\n(ATP), allowing muscle contraction, but there are critically important\ndifferences.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Explosive exercising\n(sprinting) with pure anaerobic respiration produces six to 10 seconds of immediate\nenergy with ATP and creatine phosphate stored in the fast twitch power muscles.\nNo oxygen is needed, but contractions stop after 10 seconds.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If you lower the pace\nto a hard effort you can sustain for only one to 15 minutes, you are still\nabove the anaerobic threshold (AnT). You are demanding ATP faster than the\nsystem can produce it aerobically.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You use muscle glycogen and lactate as fuel,\nbut the hydrogen ion waste products produce the toxic acidosis. This is not\nsustainable for longer distances. You produce only two ATP per molecule of\nglucose and lots of nasty stuff, which accumulates.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The aerobic (oxygen dependent) system uses the\npowerful hybrid engines (mitochondria) at the muscular level. Oxygen is\ndelivered to the engines via a rich network of capillaries (blood). Specific\nenzymes spark the process.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ATP For Short Distances: &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">ATP breaks down quickly\nto produce energy for short, high-intensity sprints and is the primary source\nof energy for sprinters. Your existing ATP stores can fuel about 30 seconds of\nstrenuous activities such as sprinting.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">After that, those stores will be\ndepleted, so you'll have to slow down. After your existing ATP is used up, your\nbody starts to convert your body's stores of glycogen into energy. However,\nthis conversion is less efficient and while you can continue exercising, your\nspeed will slow down.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ATP in Long-Distance\nRunning: &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">When you run at a lower\nintensity for longer periods of time, your body continues to make ATP at a\nslower rate, meaning that your activity will have to slow down. Your body's\nslower conversion of glucose to ATP in prolonged exercise is aerobic\nmetabolism.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">While this process is slower than anaerobic metabolism, the total\namount of ATP produced is 10 times greater. Because of this efficiency, you can\nrun for much longer periods of time at a decreased pace.</span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Long-distance runners\nburn through glucose stores, at which point the body starts to break down\nstored fat and muscle tissue to provide fuel. This is the primary reason why\nmarathon runners have a very lean appearance.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Their prolonged exercise causes\ntheir bodies to not store fat and also breaks down any excess muscle. Although\nthey can run for long periods of time, long-distance runners don't have the\nsame ATP stores available as sprinters.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Heart stroke volume\ndetermines the amount of blood that can be ejected with each heartbeat. Since\nour maximum heart rate is genetically fixed, the size of&nbsp; your heart is the only variable you can\nimprove to send more blood to the working muscles. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Blood plasma volume and\nred blood cell count are significant factors as well . A 80 kilo untrained male\nhas a blood plasma volume of roughly 6 liters. An elite athlete at the same\nweight has up to 8.5 liters of blood at his disposal. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The amount of blood the\nheart pumps with each contraction of its left ventricle\u2014the heart's largest\nchamber that is responsible for sending blood to every part of your body except\nthe lungs\u2014is called the stroke volume. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Multiply the stroke\nvolume by your heart rate, and you get the amount of blood pumped by your heart\neach minute, called the cardiac output. The larger your left ventricle, the\nmore blood it can hold; the more blood it can hold, the more blood it can pump.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So characteristic is a\nlarge heart of genetically gifted and highly trained runners that it is\nconsidered a physiological condition by the scientific and medical communities\ncalled Athlete's Heart. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While you and I may\nnever attain the heart size and associated cardiac output of champion marathon\nrunners , specific training like Yogic deep diaphragmatic kumbhaka breathing\nexercises can make your heart larger and increase your stroke volume and cardiac\noutput <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Capillary density is\nyet another important piece to deliver oxygen to your working muscles.\nAnaerobic efforts foster the growth of capillaries around fast-twitch fibers\nand lactate threshold efforts spur the growth around slow-twitch fibers. Now it\u2019s\nimportant to keep in mind that capillary growth has to be running-specific. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Again, just like an\nefficient car on a long trip, the best marathon runners also use less energy to\nrun at a given speed. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Having a high\npercentage of slow-twitch muscle fibres (better suited to endurance) compared\nto fast-twitch muscle fibres (better suited to speed and power) is also\nassociated with better running economy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Skeletal muscle is made\nup of bundles of individual muscle fibers called myocytes. Each myocyte\ncontains many myofibrils, which are strands of proteins (actin and myosin) that\ncan grab on to each other and pull.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This shortens the\nmuscle and causes muscle contraction.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Muscle fiber types can\nbe broken down into two main types: slow twitch (Type I) muscle fibers and fast\ntwitch (Type II) muscle fibers. Fast twitch fibers can be further categorized\ninto Type IIa and Type IIb fibers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On average, we have\nabout 50 percent slow twitch and 50 percent fast twitch fibers in most of the\nmuscles used for movement.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The slow muscles are\nmore efficient at using oxygen to generate more fuel (known as ATP) for\ncontinuous, extended muscle contractions over a long time. They fire more\nslowly than fast twitch fibers and can go for a long time before they fatigue.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Therefore, slow twitch\nfibers are great at helping athletes run marathons and bicycle for hours.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fast twitch fibers use\nanaerobic metabolism to create fuel, they are better at generating short bursts\nof strength or speed than slow muscles. However, they fatigue more quickly.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fast twitch fibers\ngenerally produce the same amount of force per contraction as slow muscles, but\nthey get their name because they are able to fire more rapidly. Having more\nfast twitch fibers can be an asset to a sprinter since she needs to quickly\ngenerate a lot of force.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Type IIa Fibers<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These fast twitch\nmuscle fibers are also known as intermediate fast-twitch fibers. They can use\nboth aerobic and anaerobic metabolism almost equally to create energy. In this\nway, they are a combination of Type I and Type II muscle fibers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Type IIb Fibers<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These fast twitch\nfibers use anaerobic metabolism to create energy and are the\n\"classic\" fast twitch muscle fibers that excel at producing quick,\npowerful bursts of speed. This muscle fiber has the highest rate of contraction\n(rapid firing) of all the muscle fiber types, but it also has a faster rate of\nfatigue and can't last as long before it needs rest.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Our muscle fiber type\nmay influence what sports we are naturally good at or whether we are fast or\nstrong.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Olympic sprinters have\nbeen shown to possess about 80 percent fast twitch fibers while those who excel\nin marathons tend to have 80 percent slow twitch fibers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Human skeletal muscle\nmay switch fiber types from \"fast\" to \"slow\" by yoga\ntraining.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I HAD WRITTEN ABOUT\nLACTIC ACID ABOUT 7 YEARS AGO \u2014 ONE OF MY EARLY POSTS.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I GUESS TINTU LUKA DOES\nNOT KNOW WHAT IS LACTIC ACID EVEN AFTER SO MANY YEARS OF RUNNING.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NOBODY HAS CORRECTED HER..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">JUST SHOWS WHAT INDIA IS WORTH .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/05/muscle-soreness-lactic-acid-and.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/05/muscle-soreness-lactic-acid-and.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The lactate threshold\nrelates to the ability to produce energy without accumulating high levels of\nlactate -a cause of that burning sensation you feel in your legs after a fast\nrun.&nbsp; Just like an efficient car on a\nlong trip, the best marathon runners also use less energy to run at a given\nspeed. &nbsp;&nbsp;Successful marathon runners pay\nas much attention to recovery, and getting a good night\u2019s sleep, as they do\ntraining.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Our body converts the\nfood we consume in to energy to be used for all training.&nbsp; As a marathon runner preparing for the next\nmarathon race or other endurance distance it is crucial to have at least a\nbasic understanding of how the system of energy conversion works. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You cant run like a\nmindless donkey \u2013 GADDHE&nbsp; KA&nbsp; JAISA.&nbsp;\n&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Is there NO exam for Indian\ncoaches ? &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Any gadha can be a coach? &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Subject\nMilkha Singh to a cerebral &nbsp;test and you will know his head is empty\u2014he gives hajaaar\nadvise &nbsp;on TV .&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Another female who\ncomes on TV to give hajaaaar advise is ASHWINI NACHAPPA .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Her whole claim to\nfame is that SHE BEAT PT USHA TWICE IN SPRINTS WHEN PT USHA WAS HAVING HER CHUM ( PERIODS).&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We all know Ashwini\nNachappa is called India\u2019s FLO JO only because of her fashion on track with\nleotards. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Bounty revealing fashion </span>and speaking hajaaar accent &nbsp;English\ndoes NOT win races. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-9DYM_Cfgh4E/V93YPFJMsRI/AAAAAAABL8Q/pMp5yHE1sckMMZBb_HYbcUhXLWAUbMHwwCLcB/s1600/ashwini-nCachappa.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-9DYM_Cfgh4E/V93YPFJMsRI/AAAAAAABL8Q/pMp5yHE1sckMMZBb_HYbcUhXLWAUbMHwwCLcB/s400/ashwini-nCachappa.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">She never won any major\ngold medal in her life or set any records &nbsp;yet she is a Arjuna award winner . Her name is in Karnataka school texts as an icon !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ashwini_Nachappa\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ashwini_Nachappa</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/P._T._Usha\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/P._T._Usha</a><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-I2D-Ls4ut2M/V93YeLDbfOI/AAAAAAABL8U/QUss2m2NNtAWg38Er_si_Rz3QgSXvxw6wCLcB/s1600/komp_ashwini_GI_25_14110f18g.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"627\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-I2D-Ls4ut2M/V93YeLDbfOI/AAAAAAABL8U/QUss2m2NNtAWg38Er_si_Rz3QgSXvxw6wCLcB/s640/komp_ashwini_GI_25_14110f18g.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4 decades ago &nbsp;ago I went to Nasik and met one of my cousins\n, a national level sprinter - tall , tough and handsome..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He ALWAYS lost to a short and stocky Parsi\nsprinter with a thick moustache ( who comes on TV even now to give HAJAAAR\nadvise) . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>When I asked him \u201cHow\nis it that you can never beat this Parsi runner, one foot shorter than you ? \u201c </b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: red; color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b>He replied\u2014\u201c I can beat\nhim in 100 metres race , anytime sprinting ABROAD \u2013 but never in India \u201c </b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kerala has very high standard\nof athletics.&nbsp; Last year we won the\nnational school championship for the <span style=\"background-color: cyan;\">19<sup>th</sup> consecutive year</span>&nbsp; . .&nbsp; There\nare NO good colleges in Kerala and students migrate to other states.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://indiatoday.intoday.in/education/story/kerala-news/1/586338.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://indiatoday.intoday.in/education/story/kerala-news/1/586338.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b>He said this midget Parsi sprinter takes drugs &nbsp;in India, &nbsp;as he is confident that he wont get\ncaught .&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">He predicted that his Indian sprint records will take several decades to be broken . .&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</b></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">This prophecy came true -and how !</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: medium;\"><b style=\"background-color: lime;\">DIGRESSION : &nbsp; WHEN DRUG CHEAT FLORENCE GRIFFITH JOYNER SET HER 100/ 200 METRES SPRINT WORLD RECORDS IN 1988 , I TOLD MY WIFE &nbsp;- &nbsp; THESE RECORDS CAN NEVER EVER BE BROKEN . . TEN YEARS LATER SHE WOULD DIE OF SIDE EFECTS .</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>He told me that Parsi baba's timings in\nIndia are fantastic , over his entire sprinting career , but abroad he would be always last in the heats in round one with pathetic timing.&nbsp; &nbsp;</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b>At that time I was\nfirmly convinced that drugs can only degrade performance and never enhance it .\nToday I know what he meant .</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<b style=\"background-color: cyan;\">TODAY I KNOW HOW SOME PARSI RACE HORSE OWNERS HAD CHAMPION HORSES WHOSE TIMINGS WERE OUT OF THE WORLD. &nbsp; &nbsp;</b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: cyan;\">TODAY I KNOW WHAT HORSE \" CHEATING</b><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"> SERUM</span></b><b style=\"background-color: cyan;\"> INJECTION \" MEANS &nbsp;. .&nbsp;</b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: cyan;\">BILL GATES AND PRINCE CHARLES LOVE INDIAN SERUM . &nbsp; &nbsp;THEY GET A HARD ON WHEN THEY SEE MMR VACCINE .&nbsp;</b><br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It will be a&nbsp; great insult to PT Usha if we compare her hard\nearned medals with \u201cspecially abled \u201c wheel chair bound or one legged Paralympics\nshot put winner ( no competition ) .&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>Never say a three legged donkey is equal to a champion race horse deserving KHEL RATNA --because both won a trophy.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>Let me let out a secret--&nbsp;</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>When I take over command I give the crew list to the out going Captain and tell him to mark off the entire list as <span style=\"background-color: cyan;\">GADHA</span> ( masons/ &nbsp;labour &nbsp;) and <span style=\"background-color: cyan;\">GODA</span> ( architects/ skilled workers ) .</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>Of course I formed my own opinion and always acted on my own judgement -- but this simple exercise saved me time.&nbsp;</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>I NEVER TREATED GADHA AND GODA THE SAME -- IN MY 30 YEARS OF SHIP COMMAND.</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>IF GADHA FELT BAD -- SO BE IT !</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>NEVER RAN MY SHIP ON SENTIMENTS !!</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: medium;\"><b>TODAY THE WHOLE OF INDIA HAS GONE GA GA OVER A 30 YEAR OLD RUSTIC CRASS BIHARI STUDENT DOING \"AFRICAN STUDIES \" -- WHO CANT &nbsp;UTTER A SINGLE INTELLIGENT SENTENCE. &nbsp;</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: medium;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: medium;\"><b>&nbsp;BY THE TIME I WAS 26, &nbsp;I COMMANDED A MASSIVE OIL TANKER .&nbsp;</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: medium;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: medium;\"><b>YOU CUT OFF HIS QUIVERING FOREFINGER AND DO SUBTITLES IN ENGLISH --- AND YOU WILL KNOW HOW MINDLESSLY STUPID HE IS.</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: medium;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/0J-PtKndUNQ/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/0J-PtKndUNQ?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: medium;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During intense power\nexercise, such as fast 100 metres sprinting or lifting heavy weights like\nMalleshwari , muscles rely on anaerobic metabolism, which can only produce a\ncertain amount of energy at a time, unlike the aerobic metabolism system, which\ncan produce energy over hours like for a marathon runner .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Trained marathon\nrunners have a greater ability to quickly deliver oxygen to the working muscles\nwhich increases the ability to use aerobic metabolism at a higher exercise\nintensity. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lactic acid is a\nproduct of anaerobic energy production.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/cpTArtfXNAw/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/cpTArtfXNAw?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Large bulging muscles\nof wrestler is a good example of cellular adaptation .&nbsp; The normal muscle cell might have 2,000\nmyofilaments, the hypertrophied cell might have 4,000 myofilaments.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The workload can now be\ndivided evenly among twice as many myofilaments, and the muscle cell is capable\nof more work. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The new cells are more\nrobust than their fragile cousins. The individual can do wrestling without\nexcessive fatigue, and no cell injury results from the hard session. A new\nlevel of equilibrium has been achieved by the process of cellular hypertrophy.\nA wrestler with this type of muscular development can be considered to be in\nexcellent physical condition.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Muscle hypertrophy\ninvolves an increase in size of skeletal muscle through a growth in size of its\ncomponent cells. Two factors contribute to hypertrophy: sarcoplasmic\nhypertrophy, which focuses more on increased muscle glycogen storage; and\nmyofibrillar hypertrophy, which focuses more on increased myofibril size. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Muscular hypertrophy\ncan be increased through strength training and other short-duration,\nhigh-intensity anaerobic exercises. Lower-intensity, longer-duration aerobic\nexercise generally does not result in very effective tissue hypertrophy;\ninstead, endurance athletes enhance storage of fats and carbohydrates within\nthe muscles, as well as neovascularization. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Neovascularization is\nthe formation of functional microvascular networks with red blood cell\nperfusion.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-JENHjwVCFBU/V93jPCMnPeI/AAAAAAABL8k/WE-ipfjyyYchxvlQW0OOatmOpBDe0V_MgCLcB/s1600/sports-physioloGgy-atp.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"507\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-JENHjwVCFBU/V93jPCMnPeI/AAAAAAABL8k/WE-ipfjyyYchxvlQW0OOatmOpBDe0V_MgCLcB/s640/sports-physioloGgy-atp.gif\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A large part of the\nloss of muscle mass with age is the result of disuse and atrophy rather than\nloss of muscle fibres.&nbsp; Muscles which are\nnot used shrink at an alarming rate\u2014 disuse atrophy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is NOT lactic acid\nalone which cause stiffness and soreness&nbsp;\nafter an event such as a marathon. Stiffness is caused mostly to damage\nto the muscle, and not an accumulation of lactic acid or lactic acid crystals\nin the muscle.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lactic acid does not\nexist as an acid in the body: it exists in another form called \u201clactate\u201d, and\nit is this that is actually measured in the blood when \u201clactic acid\u201d\nconcentration is determined.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/PQMsJSme780/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/PQMsJSme780?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Another misconception\nis that lactate is responsible for acidifying the blood, thereby causing\nfatigue. To the contrary, lactate is actually an important fuel that is used by\nthe muscles during prolonged exercise. Lactate released from the muscle is\nconverted in the liver to glucose, which is then used as an energy source. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So rather than cause\nfatigue, it actually helps to delay a possible lowering of blood glucose\nconcentration, a condition called hypoglycemia, and which will cause a runner\nto feel weak and fatigued if it occurs.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Muscle cells convert\nglucose or glycogen to lactic acid. Then lactic acid is absorbed converted to a\nfuel by mitochondria in muscle cells.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/uCmNQQWlrc0/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/uCmNQQWlrc0?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By training at a high\nintensity (lactate threshold training) the body creates additional proteins\nthat help absorb and convert lactic acid to energy. Thus when muscle is rebuild\nafter a power isometric workout , the secreted hormone builds the muscles by\nredirecting fat from the abdomen area of men \u2013 butt for women.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A kilo of waste fat\nrequires 7000 calories. 300 calories is burnt in one hour of brisk walking. (\nit is K calories !)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/FSJLQ-GtJM4/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/FSJLQ-GtJM4?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>Carbohydrate loading</b></span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\ncan help you race without hitting the wall\u2014as long as you do it right. Most\nrunners know they should eat pasta, rice, potatoes, or other high-carb foods\nbefore a &nbsp;marathon.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Carbs are a great source of energy, and you\nneed a lot of energy to cover&nbsp; 42 kms.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It has to be done\nproperly ,- slowly increase your carbohydrates intake about seven days leading\nup to your race.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Any physical activity\nrequires carbohydrates for fuel. For most recreational activity, your body uses\nits existing energy stores for fuel. But when you engage in long, intense\nathletic events, your body needs extra energy to keep going. The purpose of\ncarbohydrate loading is to give you the energy to complete an endurance event\nwith less fatigue, improving your athletic performance.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Carbohydrates, also\nknown as starches and sugars, are your body's main energy source. Complex\ncarbohydrates include legumes, grains and starchy vegetables, such as potatoes,\npeas and corn. Simple carbohydrates are found mainly in fruits and milk, as\nwell as in foods made with sugar, such as candy and other sweets.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During digestion, your\nbody breaks down carbohydrates into sugar. The sugar enters your bloodstream,\nwhere it's then transferred to individual cells to provide energy. Sugar is\nstored in your liver and muscles as glycogen \u2014 your energy source.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Your muscles normally\nstore only small amounts of glycogen \u2014 enough to support you during\nrecreational exercise activities. If you exercise intensely for more than 90\nminutes, your muscles may run out of glycogen. At that point, fatigue might set\nin, and your performance may suffer.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But with carbohydrate\nloading, you may be able to store up more energy in your muscles to give you\nthe stamina to make it through longer endurance events. You still will need to\nconsume some energy sources during your event.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Carbohydrate loading is\ndone the week before a high-endurance activity:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Three to four days\nbefore the event, increase your carbohydrate intake to about 10 to 12 grams of\ncarbohydrate per kilogram of body weight (70 percent of your daily calories).\nCut back on foods higher in fat to compensate for the extra carbohydrate-rich\nfoods.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Also scale back your\ntraining. Rest completely the day before your big event. The combination of\neating more carbohydrates and tapering activity appear to improve muscle\nglycogen stores.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Carbohydrate loading may give you more\nenergy during an endurance event. You may feel less fatigued and see an\nimprovement in your performance after carbohydrate loading.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/-zNG1a4OMJk/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/-zNG1a4OMJk?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Kerala labourers\ndrink HOT salted kanjee ( boiled rice gruel infused with desi ghee and coconut\nmilk \u2013YUM YUM ) for breakfast with one Kerala Nendra banana . &nbsp;After this breakfast they can slog the whole\nday in the fields without getting tired as long as they hydrate themselves .<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-OUKP-jkXQ0s/V93pbVhMGqI/AAAAAAABL80/nlzmQ8kFbeAmezj5hkC32F2hyP4Jv_EFQCLcB/s1600/gon_nendraffbale.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-OUKP-jkXQ0s/V93pbVhMGqI/AAAAAAABL80/nlzmQ8kFbeAmezj5hkC32F2hyP4Jv_EFQCLcB/s640/gon_nendraffbale.jpg\" width=\"480\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><b>WHAT DO YOU EXPECT FROM COWARDLY AMERICANS\nWHO BOMBED MILLIONS OF INNOCENT MUSLIMS ( &nbsp;LIKE SHOOTING FISH IN A BARREL )&nbsp; &nbsp;SAFELY\n&nbsp;FROM THE AIR\u2014 <o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><b>---&nbsp; AND\nTHEN CELEBRATING BACK HOME WITH TICKER TAPE PARADES AS IF THEY ARE CAESARS BRAVE VICTORIOUS &nbsp;LEGIONS .&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>WHITHER HONOUR ?</b><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-M_Oc09rCPZU/V9327cpv7uI/AAAAAAABL9E/bYuJsgQVLPoHTw4WJzqymA6AJuyuYJ3AgCLcB/s1600/1991%252BGulf%252BHWar%252BVeterans%252BParade.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-M_Oc09rCPZU/V9327cpv7uI/AAAAAAABL9E/bYuJsgQVLPoHTw4WJzqymA6AJuyuYJ3AgCLcB/s640/1991%252BGulf%252BHWar%252BVeterans%252BParade.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">HEY AGENT GANDHI -- WHEN CHINA INVADES INDIA , WE WILL NOT HAVE A MAN LIKE YOU LEADING US . OR PROTECTING BHARATMATA &nbsp;. &nbsp;</b></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">WE WILL NOT GIVE LOBE - NAY -LOVE AND SPIN THE CHARKHA-- &nbsp;WE WILL KICK PRIME CHINESE ASS !</b></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both;
