In\ncontrast, for every 1 liter oxygen you take in, you burn 1.23 grams of\ncarbohydrate and produce 5.0 kcal energy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: x-large;\"><b>Fat is excellent\nfor STORAGE, carbohydrates are excellent for USAGE.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c4179127770993923460\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_116M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/09/marathon-running-secrets-of_17.html?showComment=1474273267997#c4179127770993923460\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">September 19, 2016 at 1:51 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_116MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>WE THE WORLD CITIZENS DEMAND THAT WADA BE DISMANTED</b></span><br />\n<br />\nTHIS CHEAT ORGANISATION TAKES MONEY TO SPONSOR CHEATING ATHLETES OF ZIONIST JEW NATION ( EXAMPLE--SIMON BILES )<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br />WE THANK RUSSIAN HACKERS FOR EXPOSING CHEAT WADA . .</span></b><br />\n<br />\nThe World Anti-Doping Agency is a foundation created through a collective initiative led by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) -set up on November 10, 1999 in Lausanne, Switzerland-- to promote, coordinate and monitor the fight against drugs in sports.<br />\n<br />\nWHAT THEY DO IS TO SPONSOR SELECT NATIONS TO CHEAT.<br />\n<br />\nWADA accredits around 30 laboratories to perform the required scientific analysis for doping control.<br />\n<br />\nBEING A CAPTAIN FOR 30 YEARS , I CAN TELL YOU THAT IF YOU HAVE A US OR BRITISH FLAG ON THE SHIP ( REGISTERED ) THEN ALL ZIONIST JEW INSPECTION AGENCIES LITERALLY SPARE YOU FROM EVEN A CURSORY INSPECTION<br />\n<br />\nI CAN VOUCH FOR THIS-- FOR I HAVE COMMANDED SHIPS WITH US AND BRITISH FLAG FLUTTERING ON MY SHIPs STERN<br />\n<br />\nIN FACT WHEN I JOINED A CHEMICAL TANKER OWNED BY A TEL AVIV JEW, WITH A BRITISH FLAG AT THE STERN, MY FIRST MESSAGE TO THE COMPANY WAS THAT I REFUSE TO WEAR UNIFORM OR MY PEAK CAP WHICH MY WIFE HAS SO THOUGHTFULLY PACKED UP FOR ME ..<br />\n<br />\nTHE JEW OWNER DID A QUID PRO QUO WITH THE UK GOVT-- I TAKE SAY 100 OF BRITISH CADETS TO WORK ON MY SHIPS--AND YOU IN RETURN SHALL FLAG SO MANY OF MY SHIPS WITH BRITISH REGISTRY .<br />\n<br />\nTHAT BRITISH FLAGGED SHIP WAS MY WORST-- WITH ALL EAST EUROPEAN OFFICERS WITH FAKE CERTIFICATES OF COMPETENCY ( GEORGIA MAFIA )<br />\n<br />\nI USED TO BE SO FED UP THAT WHEN OFFICERS FUCK IT UP-- I WOULD STAND ON A CHAIR TO MEET THEM EYE TO EYE AND SLAP THEM LEFT AND RIGHT.<br />\n<br />\nTHE OTHER OPTION WAS TO SEND THEM BACK HOME.. I DID NOT DO THAT AS I KNEW THEY WERE ALL BREAD WINNERS AT HOME-<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>WADA FUCK OFF !</b></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c8302433890736861782\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_118M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/09/marathon-running-secrets-of_17.html?showComment=1474275285122#c8302433890736861782\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">September 19, 2016 at 2:24 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_118MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhttp://www.climatechangenews.com/2016/09/13/simple-planting-switch-could-slash-rice-methane-emissions/<br />\n<br />\nTHE NEW KOSHER CONSPIRACY IS TO MAKE INDIA CONVERT ALL PRICELESS VEDIC VEDIC RICE TO TOXIC GM RICE<br />\n<br />\nALREADY APCO MODI IS ON THE JOB--OF FLOODING INDIAN WITH GM ZINC INFUSED RICE. . . NOBEL PRIZE MILENGA . .<br />\n<br />\nhttp://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/City/Coimbatore/TNAU-researching-on-ways-to-fortifiy-rice-with-zinc-iron/articleshow/52116870.cms<br />\n<br />\nFILIPNOS DO NOT KNOW THAT THEIR NATIONs BRAINS HAVE BEEN DEGRADED BY FOUL GM ZINC INFUSED RICE --WITHOUT TELLING THE PEOPLE .<br />\n<br />\nTHE GM GOLDEN RICE ( VITAMIN A ENRICHED --SIC ) IN THIRD WORLD NATIONS HAVE CAUSED AUTISM AND STILL BIRTHS<br />\n<br />\nGolden Rice carry derivatives which may cause teratogenicity \u2013 MONSTER CHILDREN and still births.<br />\n<br />\nAFTER A CONTRACT ON CHEMICAL TANKERS THE CAPTAIN HAS TO GIVE OUT GOING CREW A CERTIFICATE IN CASE THEY HAVE WORKED ON THE SHIP WHEN IT CARRIED DNA DAMAGING CHEMICALS. &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;THEN THE COMPANY HAS TO DO TESTS ON THEIR EXPENSE BEFORE SENDING CREW HOME.<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/09/gm-ir8-rice-high-amylose-content.html<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">Persistent, bioaccumulative, toxic chemicals are called PBT.</span> &nbsp; &nbsp;Toxic chemicals can cause a change in hormone composition or cause a disruption of the endocrine system. The endocrine system is composed of glands that secrete chemicals called hormones into the bloodstream for the control of body functions. These contaminants can imitate endocrine hormones or inhibit the action of endocrine hormones. They are called <span style=\"color: red;\">endocrine disruptors</span>. &nbsp; &nbsp;Mutagen is an agent that changes the DNA.<br />\nTeratogenesis literally meaning monster-making, which derives from teratology, the study of the frequency, causation, and development of congenital malformations\u2014misleadingly called birth defects.<span style=\"color: blue;\"> These include gross morphological abnormalities, such as cleft lip.</span> May also include phenomena such as increased risk of cervical cancer or discoloration of tooth enamel.<br />\n<br />\nDEFINITELY I KNOW MORE THAN MODI OR HIS ADVISERS ON THIS SUBJECT<br />\n<br />\nOF COURSE PMO ( WHO KNOWS SHIT ) MIGHT CALL THIS FICTION . .<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Protein requirement of\nathletes is higher than those of sedentary people.&nbsp; It takes care of muscle trauma that results\nfrom frequent muscle contraction and for healing of injuries to muscle fibres. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">High intensity,\ncontinued exercises for a long duration increases oxidation of amino acids for\nfuelling our body and protein is used as an energy. This makes a greater\ninfluence to total energy production during endurance exercise when muscle\nglycogen levels are low.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Intensive marathon\nexercise can lead to muscle tissue loss. Eating sufficient calories,\ncarbohydrates and protein will help keep away this wasting. Endurance training\npushes protein needs to 25% to 50% more than of DV (daily value).</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No matter what time you\nrun but what you eat post your run may determine the quality of your next\nworkout and a combination of carbohydrate and protein, 30 minutes after hard\nrunning can rebuild glycogen stores better than carbohydrates alone. This combo\nalso speed muscle recovery.&nbsp; &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;As an essential mineral, an electrolyte cannot\nbe substituted by any other nutrient in the diet. That means that your body\nwill only accept that particular mineral or electrolyte. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Without electrolytes,\nyou could not move, think, or live. Within the body, electrolytes are dissolved\nin body fluids. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In terms of hydration,\nelectrolytes are responsible for directing water (and nutrients) to the areas\nof the body where its needed most and maintaining optimal fluid balance inside\nthe cells. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Besides maintaining\nfluid balance, electrolytes help your muscles to contract and relax and assist\nin the transmission of nerve impulses&nbsp; from\nyour nervous system to different body parts.</span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The types of Tempo runs\nare:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Continuous Tempo - long\nslow runs at 50 to 70% of maximum heart rate. This places demands on muscle and\nliver glycogen. The normal response by the system is to enhance muscle and\nliver glycogen storage capacities and glycolytic activity associated with these\nprocesses<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Extensive Tempo -\ncontinuous runs at 60 to 80% of maximum heart rate. This places demands on the\nsystem to cope with lactate production. Running at this level assists the\nremoval and turnover of lactate and the body's ability to tolerate greater\nlevels of lactate<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Intensive Tempo -\ncontinuous runs at 80 to 90% of maximum heart rate. Lactate levels become high\nas these runs boarder on speed endurance and special endurance. Intensive tempo\ntraining provides the base for the development of anaerobic energy systems</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The oxidative (or\naerobic) system is your slow-burning furnace, always humming in the background,\nwhether you\u2019re fast asleep or running hard. It\u2019s fueled largely on fat and\nglucose, and, of the three metabolic pathways that support exercise, it\u2019s the\nonly one that directly requires oxygen to function.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The aerobic system can\nuse carbohydrates, fats, or proteins to produce energy. Energy production is\nslower, but more efficient than the other two systems. As you can tell by the\nname, the aerobic system requires that there be adequate oxygen available to\nthe working muscles.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Therefore this system is used more heavily during\nlow-intensity activity, but actually, most of our races, even a 5k mostly use\nthe aerobic system. One key highlight of aerobic metabolism is the ability to\nburn fat as fuel.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Our bodies have a seemingly unlimited capacity for storing\nfat and fat provides over twice as much energy per gram than protein or\ncarbohydrate, making it a very attractive choice for energy production.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In\nprolonged activities where intensity is low, the body will use fat as a main\nenergy source and spare the use of muscle glycogen and blood glucose so that it\nis available for use if exercise intensity increases and oxygen availability is\ndecreased.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Keep in mind that aerobic\nmetabolism doesn\u2019t use one substrate exclusively. Although you may be burning\nmostly fat, a steady supply of carbohydrate is still necessary for the\nbreakdown of fat into an energy source.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/vhZVUuWInKU/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/vhZVUuWInKU?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/i7AezyXc22Y/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/i7AezyXc22Y?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are no negative\nbyproducts of the aerobic system: only water and carbon dioxide which an\nathlete sweats and exhales. &nbsp;&nbsp;However,\nthere is one negative, heat, and this has to be carefully considered during\ntraining.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As we use the aerobic system\nat high levels a lot of heat is generated in the cells, and this heat\naccelerates the breakdown of the cells. Too much breakdown and the athlete will\nlose aerobic capacity. That is why training at or above threshold must be\nlimited in a sensible training program.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One of the most elegant\nadaptations to endurance training is an increase in the size of the left ventricle.\nThe larger the left ventricle, the more blood it can hold; the more blood it\ncan hold, the more it can pump. Multiply stroke volume by heart rate, and you\nget cardiac output, the volume of blood the heart pumps per minute.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Running lots of miles\nimproves blood vessels\u2019 oxygen-carrying capability by increasing the number of\nred blood cells and hemoglobin, stimulates the storage of more glycogen in the\nmuscles, increases the use of intramuscular fat to spare glycogen, creates a\ngreater capillary network for a more rapid diffusion of oxygen into the muscles\nand, through the complex activation of gene expression, increases mitochondrial\ndensity and aerobic enzyme activity, increasing aerobic metabolic capacity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/kJRmcNqcg4U/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/kJRmcNqcg4U?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Before the 1970s lactic\nacid was considered a waste by-product resulting from a lack of available\noxygen to the working muscles. It was blamed for the burning sensation during\nvigorous exercise, delayed onset muscle soreness and central to the process of\nfatigue. The general consensus was, and still is amongst many coaches and\nathletes, that lactic acid is responsible for fatigue and exhaustion in all\ntypes of exercise.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On the contrary, lactic\nacid only accumulates within muscle during relatively short, highly intense\nexercise such as sprint swimming or running. Endurance athletes, such as\nmarathon runners for example can have near-resting lactic acid levels following\na race despite being exhausted (2).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1984, George Brooks\n(6) proposed the lactate shuttle hypothesis and at present, the cell-to-cell\nlactate shuttle has almost unanimous experimental support. This hypothesis\nquestioned many of the widely held beliefs about lactate.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Far from being a waste\nproduct, the formation of lactate allows the metabolism of carbohydrates to\ncontinue through glycolysis. Keep in mind from the energy systems article that\nglycolysis allows rapid production of energy required to sustain intense\nexercise.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Clearance of lactate\nfrom the blood can occur either through oxidation within the muscle fibre in\nwhich it was produced or it can be transported to other muscles fibres for\noxidation. Lactate that is not oxidized in this way diffuses from the\nexercising muscle into the capillaries and it is transported via the blood to\nthe liver .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Through a process known as the <span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b>Cori cycle</b></span>, lactate can be converted\nto pyruvate in the presence of oxygen, which can then be converted into\nglucose. This glucose can either be metabolized by working muscles or stored in\nthe muscles as glycogen for later use <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So lactate should be\nviewed as a useful form of potential energy that is oxidized during\nmoderate-low intensity exercise, during recovery and at rest. Unlike lactic\nacid, lactate is not thought to be fatigue-producing .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c1767285083018790724\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_50M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/02503669776887371943\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Alka Budhraja</a></cite><span class=\"icon user\" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2012/05/so-ham-mantra-expand-your-consciousness.html?showComment=1474346255225#c1767285083018790724\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">September 20, 2016 at 10:07 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_50MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nHi Captain!Tell us more about Maharishi Kartikeyaji.He is believed to have lived for 335yrs before he took Mahasamadhi in 1935 in Ayodhya. He taught Suksham Vigyan Yoga.<br />\nThere are many secret practices of yoga which were never reveald to even the pupils of yogies. Yoga as it is,was in ancient times only taughy by the great himalayan saints to disciples who had renounced the world. The Pranayam exercises were special and very secret....as they purified the body of all past life bad karmas... thus changing the life of a person. So-hum is one such pranayam. It polishes the nadis and burns all bad karmas attached to it.<br />\nMaharishi Kartikeyaji was the Guru of Dhirendra Bhramchari the(wayward) family Guru of the Nehru Dinasty. Sonia and Rajiv also visited him daily to learn Yoga.He is believed to be the reason for long rein of this family in Politics. Though all were Misfits. , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">When\nthe human body reaches the age of 27 years, the secretion of nitric oxide is at\nits peak. As you get&nbsp; older and the\nproduction of nitric oxide in the human body declines gradually, more from age\n42 onwards.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">The\nendothelium (inner lining) of blood vessels uses Nitric oxide to signal the\nsurrounding smooth muscle to relax, thus resulting in vasodilation and\nincreasing blood flow. Nitric oxide is highly reactive (having a lifetime of a\nfew seconds), yet diffuses freely across membranes.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Normally,\nin a young person who does not have hardened arteries,&nbsp; the blood vessels make sufficient amounts of\nNitric oxide, and there is no need to take any medicine. When people get old\nand have heart problems due to hardened arteries and angina pain, you can give\nNitric oxide -&nbsp; (nitroglycerin in a pill\nkept under the tongue ).<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">The\nvasodilatory actions of Nitric oxide plays a key role in renal control of\nextracellular fluid homeostasis and is essential for the regulation of blood\nflow and blood pressure.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">By\ndilating (expanding) the veins, Nitric oxide drugs lower arterial pressure and\nleft ventricular filling pressure.This vasodilation does not decrease the\nvolume of blood the heart pumps, but rather it decreases the force the heart\nmuscle must exert to pump the same volume of blood. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">The\ninterior surface (endothelium) of your arteries produce nitric oxide. When\nplaque builds up in your arteries, called atherosclerosis, you reduce your capacity\nto produce Nitric oxide, which is why physicians prescribe nitroglycerin for\nheart and stroke patients.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Viagra,\nstimulates erections primarily by enhancing signaling through the nitric oxide\npathway in the penis. Old guys with with atherosclerosis, diabetes, or\nhypertension OR young TATTU pickle Johns often show impaired Nitric Oxide\npathways\u2014 and hence, sorry,&nbsp; NO hop!<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Nitric\noxide also serves as a neurotransmitter between nerve cells, part of its\ngeneral role in redox signaling. Unlike most other neurotransmitters that only transmit\ninformation from a presynaptic to a postsynaptic neuron, the small, uncharged,\nand fat-soluble nitric oxide molecule can diffuse widely and readily enters\ncells.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Nitric\noxide is an important neurotransmitter in various parts of the gastrointestinal\ntract. It causes relaxation of the gastrointestinal smooth muscle. In the\nstomach it increases the capacity of the fundus to store food and fluids.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Nitric\noxide acts on cardiac muscle to decrease contractility and heart rate. Nitric\noxide contributes to the regulation of cardiac contractility. , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">AGNIHOTRA\nGENERATES NITRIC OXIDE <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Lord\nKrishna tells a despondant Arjuna , just before the Mahabharata battle 6000\nyear ago, :- Life is born from food, food is produced by rain, rain is produced\nby performing yagna and that yagnya is performed by doing Karma.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">HOMAN\n/ YAGNA PRODUCED RAIN BY SEEDING CLOUDS WITH SILVER IODIDE.&nbsp; WE INDIANS WERE THE FIRST TO DO THIS.&nbsp; TODAY THE WHITE MAN HAS PATENTED IT IN HIS\nNAME<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">In\nmodern times Silver iodide is used in cloud seeding.. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">For\nrelease by aircraft, silver iodide flares are ignited and dispersed as an\naircraft flies through the inflow of a cloud.&nbsp;\nWhen released by devices on the ground, the fine particles are carried\ndownwind and upward by air currents after release. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">&nbsp;China used cloud seeding in Beijing just\nbefore the 2008 Olympic Games in order to clear the air of&nbsp; severe smog.</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-size: large;\"><b>THIS BLOGSITE ASKS THE HINDUS OF PAKISTAN<br /><br />AND THE BALOCHISTAN PEOPLE</b></span><br /><br /><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>TAKE MOBILE PHONE VIDEOS OF EVERY ATROCITY COMMITTED BY PAKISTANI RULERS , POLICE AND ARMY&nbsp;</b></span><br /><br />GIVE IT TO INDIA<br /><br /><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>WE WILL FILE CHARGES FOR \"WAR CRIMES \", GENOCIDE AND ETHNIC CLEANSING<br /><br />WE WILL HANG THESE PAKISTANI BASTARDS LIKE SADDAM HUSSAIN</b></span><br />NOTE : FOR THE BLOGSITE SADDAM HUSSIAN IS A HERO .</div>\n</div>\n<b style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: cyan;\">Below: WE IN KERALA ARE PROUD OF OUR ANCIENT CULTURE AND OUR BEAUTIFUL FERTILE LAND -- &nbsp;GODS OWN COUNTRY &nbsp;</b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><br /></b><b style=\"background-color: cyan;\">OURS IS THE MOST ANCIENT CIVILIZATION ON THE PLANET , &nbsp;THE FOUNTAINHEAD OF EVERY VESTIGE OF ANCIENT KNOWLEDGE AND RELIGION , WITH THE CAPITAL AT CALICUT , &nbsp;MY HOMETOWN-- &nbsp;</b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: cyan;\">OUR GURU WAS MAHARISHI SHUKRACHARYA &nbsp;-- THE GIANT AMONG ALL MAHARISHIS &nbsp;-</b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: cyan;\">OUR KALARI WARRIORS COULD EAT OPPONENTS FOR BREAKFAST- &nbsp;NOBODY DARED ATTACK KERALA ..</b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: cyan;\">KERALAs SOCIAL INDICATORS ARE THE BEST ON THE PLANET-- &nbsp;LITERACY IS 100% -- THERE WAS NO SPICE OF HERB WE DID NOT HAVE &nbsp;</b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: cyan;\">OUR WOMEN ARE DOCILE -- THEY DONT NEED PLASTIC IN UPPER LIPS AND TITS &nbsp;</b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: cyan;\">OUR LANGUAGE MALAYALAM BINDS US -- -</b><br />\n<br />\n<div style=\"background-color: white; color: #252525; font-family: sans-serif; font-size: 14px; line-height: inherit; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-top: 0.5em;\">\nKerala's unusual socioeconomic and demographic situation was summarized by author and environmentalist&nbsp;<a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bill_McKibben\" style=\"background: none; color: #0b0080; text-decoration: none;\" title=\"Bill McKibben\">Bill McKibben</a>:<sup class=\"reference\" id=\"cite_ref-McKibben_2006_26-0\" style=\"font-size: 11.2px; line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; white-space: nowrap;\"><a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kerala_model#cite_note-McKibben_2006-26\" style=\"background: none; color: #0b0080; text-decoration: none;\">[26]</a></sup></div>\n<dl style=\"color: #252525; font-family: sans-serif; font-size: 14px; margin-bottom: 0.5em; margin-top: 0.2em;\"><dd style=\"margin-bottom: 0.1em; margin-left: 1.6em; margin-right: 0px;\"><table cellpadding=\"4\" style=\"background-color: #ddddff; border: thin solid rgb(221, 221, 255); font-size: 14px; margin: 20px;\"><tbody>\n<tr><td><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Kerala, a state in India, is a bizarre anomaly among developing nations, a place that offers real hope for the future of the Third World. Though not much larger than Maryland, Kerala has a population as big as California's and a per capita annual income of less than $300. But its infant mortality rate is very low, its literacy rate among the highest on Earth, and its birthrate below America's and falling faster. Kerala's residents live nearly as long as Americans or Europeans. Though mostly a land of paddy-covered plains, statistically Kerala stands out as the Mount Everest of social development; there's truly no place like it.<sup class=\"reference\" id=\"cite_ref-McKibben_2006_26-1\" style=\"font-size: 11.2px; line-height: 1; unicode-bidi: isolate; white-space: nowrap;\"><a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kerala_model#cite_note-McKibben_2006-26\" style=\"background-attachment: initial; background-clip: initial; background-image: none; background-origin: initial; background-position: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-size: initial; color: #0b0080; text-decoration: none;\">[26]</a></sup></span></td></tr>\n</tbody></table>\n</dd></dl>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/GZDX2XLCuuA/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/GZDX2XLCuuA?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\">Below: YOURS &nbsp;TRULY having a blast during Onam celebrations</span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOG_video_class\" contentid=\"eac499514f6b1dc9\" height=\"266\" id=\"BLOG_video-eac499514f6b1dc9\" width=\"320\"></object></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\">TO BE CONTINUED--</span></b><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-pcCtK1fJJcI/V91786JJkPI/AAAAAAABL8A/RbM-FagL1qwW5D8hXJbl0SjQHj2ijz0kACLcB/s1600/bbbbb.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-pcCtK1fJJcI/V91786JJkPI/AAAAAAABL8A/RbM-FagL1qwW5D8hXJbl0SjQHj2ijz0kACLcB/s320/bbbbb.jpg\" width=\"143\" /></a></div>\n<br />\nCAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL<br />\n..</div>\n", "author": {"id": "14410812789424637654", "displayName": "Capt. Ajit Vadakayil", "url": "https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654", "image": {"url": "//4.bp.blogspot.com/-QSnd-Z8F7Kc/XFtPudWdwlI/AAAAAAABfq4/vxrkFOO7Iu8Mf6-OaPgw6FPpRDSmMgLdgCK4BGAYYCw/s35/capt%25252BajitC%25252Bvadakayil.JPG"}}, "replies": {"totalItems": "219", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/6422994269482285687/comments"}}, {"kind": "blogger#post", "id": "1436850898886047366", "blog": {"id": "3564735312144269387"}, "published": "2016-09-16T13:07:00+05:30", "updated": "2016-09-17T22:56:57+05:30", "etag": "\"iHf3yWDE_geBgZ8U7rgZ_xuTeAQ/dGltZXN0YW1wOiAxNDc0MTMzMjE3NzE4Cm9mZnNldDogMTk4MDAwMDAK\"", "url": "http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/09/marathon-running-secrets-of_16.html", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/1436850898886047366", "title": "MARATHON RUNNING , SECRETS OF ELECTROLYTES AND PERSONALISED DRINKS , part 2 \u2013 CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL", "content": "<div dir=\"ltr\" style=\"text-align: left;\" trbidi=\"on\">\n<div dir=\"ltr\" style=\"text-align: left;\" trbidi=\"on\">\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">THIS POST IS &nbsp;CONTINUED FROM PART 1 , BELOW-</span></b><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/09/marathon-running-secrets-of.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/09/marathon-running-secrets-of.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE FIRST MARATHON\nRUNNER GREEK PHEIDIPPIDES RAN 26.2 MILES , &nbsp;FAINTED LIKE OP JAISHA , WENT\nINTO A COMA AND DIED IN 4890 BC<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pheidippides ran from\nMarathon to Athens to deliver news of a military victory against the Persians\nat the Battle of Marathon.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-oX1dKqGI7pA/V9uja-nNGdI/AAAAAAABL5g/Hhz1Q2pps9YVUd6hyZrCCfteVAihjAKXQCLcB/s1600/B0F02502.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"462\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-oX1dKqGI7pA/V9uja-nNGdI/AAAAAAABL5g/Hhz1Q2pps9YVUd6hyZrCCfteVAihjAKXQCLcB/s640/B0F02502.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Electrolytes serve\nthree general functions in the body:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">many are essential\nminerals<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">they control osmosis of\nwater between body compartments<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">they help maintain the\nacid-base balance required for normal cellular activities<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The electrolyte\ncomposition of sweat is variable but comprises of the following components:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sodium<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Potassium<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Calcium<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Magnesium<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chloride<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bicarbonate<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Phosphate<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sulphate<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A litre of sweat\ntypically contains 0.02g Calcium, 0.05g Magnesium, 1.15g Sodium, 0.23g\nPotassium and 1.48g Chloride. This composition will vary from person to person.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In blood plasma the\nparticles will comprise of sodium, proteins and glucose<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At the physiological\nlevel, running a marathon requires an aerobic base, strong muscles, and an\nabundance of glycogen. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During a marathon\nrun of 42 kms , metabolic rates drastically change, which requires the\nendocrine, respiratory and neuromuscular systems to perform at elevated levels\nfor longer-than-average amounts of time.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The principal cation\ninside the cell is Potassium and the principal cation outside the cell is\nSodium. A fluid imbalance between these two compartments is caused by a change\nin the Potassium or Sodium concentration.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sodium balance in the body is\ncontrolled by aldosterone and antidiuretic hormone (ADH).&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; ADH regulates extracellular fluid\nelectrolyte concentration by adjusting the amount of water reabsorbed into the\nblood by the kidneys.&nbsp;&nbsp; Aldosterone\nregulates extracellular fluid volume by adjusting the amount of sodium\nreabsorbed by the blood from the kidneys.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Running a marathon in\nhot eather resuts in a decrease in the sodium concentration in interstitial\nfluid. During sweating the skin\nexcretes sodium as well as water. &nbsp;If we\nreplace the lost fluid with just plain water then we may produce a sodium\ndeficit. &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The decrease in sodium\nconcentration in the interstitial fluid lowers the interstitial fluid osmotic\npressure and establishes an effective water concentration between the\ninterstitial fluid and the intracellular fluid. &nbsp;Water moves from the interstitial fluid into\nthe cells, producing &nbsp;results that can be\nquite serious<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Whenever your blood\nsodium levels go low after drinking a tall glass of water, a hormone called\n\u201canti-diuretic hormone\u201d (ADH) becomes suppressed and you produce a very dilute\nurine bringing your sodium levels back to normal.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vasopressin, also known\nas antidiuretic hormone (ADH), is a neurohypophysial hormone which retain water\nin the body and &nbsp;constrict blood vessels<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vasopressin promotes\nrenal water reabsorption decreasing excretion of free water to dilute plasma\nand lower serum osmolality.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vasopressin plays a key\nrole in maintaining osmolality (the concentration of dissolved particles, such\nas salts and glucose, in the serum) and therefore in maintaining the volume of\nwater in the extracellular fluid (the fluid space that surrounds cells). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is necessary to\nprotect cells from sudden increases or decreases in water content, which are\ncapable of interfering with proper cell function.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the kidneys,\nvasopressin acts on the cells of the collecting ducts. These cells contain\nreceptors for vasopressin that are linked to vesicles that contain special water\nchannels (aquaporins). When the cells are stimulated by vasopressin, the\naquaporins fuse with the region of the cell membrane that is exposed to urine,\nallowing water to enter the cells.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The water is then\nreturned to the circulation. This causes the volume of urine to decrease and\nthe urinary content of sodium, chloride, and other substances to increase. When\nthis occurs, the urine is said to be concentrated.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vasopressin is also\nreleased in response to a decrease in blood volume. Special pressure sensors called\nbaroreceptors can detect arterial blood pressure; they are located in the\ncarotid sinus, which is intimately associated with each carotid artery high in\nthe neck, and in a group of specialized cells in the left atrium of the heart. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When blood volume increases,\nthe tissues of the carotid sinus and left atrium are stretched, and the nerves\nin the baroreceptors are stimulated. These nerves carry impulses to the\nvasopressin-producing nerve cells that inhibit the secretion of vasopressin,\nresulting in increased water excretion. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Conversely, if blood\nvolume decreases, the stretch of the carotid sinus and left atrium decreases,\nvasopressin release increases, and water excretion decreases, thereby helping\nto restore blood volume to normal.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">European guidelines classify\nhyponatremia in adults according to serum sodium concentration, as follows--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mild: 130-134 mmol/L<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Moderate: 125-129\nmmol/L<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Profound: <125 mmol=\"\" o:p=\"\"></125></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hypovolemic\nhyponatremia: decrease in total body water with greater decrease in total body\nsodium<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Euvolemic hyponatremia:\nnormal body sodium with increase in total body water<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hypervolemic\nhyponatremia: increase in total body sodium with greater increase in total body\nwater<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hyponatremia can be\nfurther subclassified according to effective osmolality, as follows:---</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hypotonic hyponatremia<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Isotonic hyponatremia<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hypertonic hyponatremia<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hypotonic hyponatremia\naccounts for most clinical cases of hyponatremia and can be treated with\nfluids.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Administer isotonic\nsaline to patients who are hypovolemic to replace the contracted intravascular\nvolume. Patients with hypovolemia secondary to diuretics may also need\npotassium repletion, which, like sodium, is osmotically active.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Treat patients who are\nhypervolemic with salt and fluid restriction, plus loop diuretics, and correction\nof the underlying condition. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For euvolemic,\nasymptomatic hyponatremic patients, free water restriction (&lt; 1 L/day) is\ngenerally the treatment of choice. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">No sexual predilection\nexists for hyponatremia. However, symptoms are more likely to occur in young\nwomen than in men.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Patients with\nhypertonic hyponatremia have normal total body sodium and a dilutional drop in\nthe measured serum sodium due to the presence of osmotically active molecules\nin the serum, which causes a water shift from the intracellular compartment to\nthe extracellular compartment.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Glucose produces a drop\nin the serum sodium level of 1.6 mEq/L for each 100 mg/dL of serum glucose\ngreater than 100 mg/dL.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Two types of\nelectrolytes, sodium and potassium, are involved in the control of fluid\nvolume.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Body fluid is either\ninside cells, as intracellular fluid (ICF), or outside cells, as extracellular\nfluid (ECF), which includes blood plasma. The amount of sodium in the body\ndetermines the ECF volume, whereas potassium determines the ICF volume.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Water\ncrosses the membranes separating ICF from ECF, and its movement is influenced\nby the number of ions in each compartment \u2013 the osmolality. The less water in\nthe blood, the greater the concentration of electrolytes and the greater the\nosmolality.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Humans sweat more than\nany other animal \u2013 rates can exceed 500g/m2 per hour \u2013 losing water and\nelectrolytes, particularly sodium, in varying amounts. The concentration of\nsodium in sweat is always less than its concentration in the ECF, so sweating\nwithout drinking causes the concentration of sodium in the ECF to rise,\ntriggering the thirst mechanism.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The low blood sodium\nconcentration in EAH is caused by drinking too much fluid.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Taking on extra sodium\nbefore or during exercise will not prevent EAH developing in those who drink in\nexcess of the dictates of thirst. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Consuming carbohydrate\nduring marathon running improves performance.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sports drinks allow two\ngoals to be achieved: first, hydration; second, the delivery of carbohydrate. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Potassium levels are\nnaturally high in vegetables and fruits, and sodium levels are naturally low<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sports drinks and gels\nare great at delivering carbohydrate and water. But there is no need to consume\nextra sodium during a marathon run.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The amount of water\npresent in our bodies has to be regulated \u2013 it can\u2019t veer towards extremes or\nelse our health will suffer.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Sodium ensures the correct water level is\nmaintained at all times. It combines with potassium to form an electrical pump\nso that electrolyte balance isn\u2019t disrupted both in and outside cells. It is\nalso responsible for regulating blood volume and promoting muscle and nerve\nfunctions.</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kidneys are paired\norgans that are mainly responsible for maintaining the balance of fluids, as\nwell as electrolytes such as calcium, magnesium, potassium, sodium, etc. Sodium\nplays a vital role in regulating the fluid balance.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Water intoxication, which\nis medically referred to as dilutional hyponatremia, is a condition wherein the\nconcentration of sodium in blood becomes low due to the consumption of\nexcessive amounts of PURE water..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">When blood\nconcentration of sodium falls below 135 millimoles per liter, the level of salt\nin our blood becomes low. Under such circumstances, water begins to seep into\nthe cells. This process could lead to massive cellular damage. This has\nhappened to OP Jaisha. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Her cough on TV\nnewshour show was NOT swine flue.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The sensation of\nphysiological thirst is stimulated by both a decrease in the amount of water in\nthe blood (also called hypovolemia) and by increased plasma osmolality.\nOsmolality is the amount of dissolved particles, such as sodium or glucose, in\nthe blood. Both hypovolemia and increased plasma osmolality occur during\ndehydration due to sweating.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>Kidney\nbuyers have their stooge \"QUOTA/ donation party doctors\" on benami TV &nbsp;to tell you that you just need one kidney and\nthe second kidney can be sold for money<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>This\nis a LIE.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;
