font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This includes such factors as\nmitochondria concentration within the muscle, aerobic enzyme concentration and\nmyoglobin concentration in the working muscle, which \u2018picks up\u2019 the available\noxygen being delivered by the blood.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/LEKj5avQfUY/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/LEKj5avQfUY?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/ieyzL5OaPZk/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/ieyzL5OaPZk?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-98gICPu02Ls/V9zqCpZmPpI/AAAAAAABL7E/pzCTbM_vWV4x-Sie6fVCbawa2D8wypeqgCLcB/s1600/advanced-cardio-routine-fitness-incline-sprintsM-expert-treadmill-speed-workout-he-and-she-eat-clean.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-98gICPu02Ls/V9zqCpZmPpI/AAAAAAABL7E/pzCTbM_vWV4x-Sie6fVCbawa2D8wypeqgCLcB/s640/advanced-cardio-routine-fitness-incline-sprintsM-expert-treadmill-speed-workout-he-and-she-eat-clean.png\" width=\"346\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">HIIT leads to greater\nimprovements in VO2 max&nbsp;</span></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">HIIT is a training idea\nin which low to moderate intensity intervals are alternated with high intensity\nintervals.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">HIIT can be applied to\nrunning or to exercises such as squatting. HIIT is considered to be much more\neffective than normal cardio because the intensity is higher and you are able\nto increase both your aerobic and anaerobic endurance while burning more fat\nthan ever before.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span></span></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">HIIT has been shown to\nburn adipose tissue more effectively than low-intensity exercise - up to 50%\nmore efficiently. &nbsp;It has also been shown\nto speed up your metabolism which helps you burn more calories .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/dkikq_fYBNw/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/dkikq_fYBNw?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Theoretically, the more\noxygen you can use during high-level exercise, the more ATP (energy) you can\nproduce. This is often the case with elite endurance athletes who typically\nhave very high VO2 max values.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">V02 max should not be\nconfused with the lactate threshold (LT) or anaerobic threshold (AT), which\nrefers to the point during exhaustive, all-out exercise at which lactate builds\nup in the muscles during exercise. With proper training, athletes are often\nable to substantially increase their AT and exercise longer at a higher\nintensity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">VO2 max can be\nincreased through exercising between 65-to-85 per cent of maximal heart rate\nover at least 20 minutes per session, three-to-five times per week</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">VO2 Max and Factors\nthat affect maximum work:&nbsp; VO2 Max\ndecreases about 9% per decade after 25 (if training is discontinued).&nbsp; Males have a higher VO2Max than females.&nbsp; Training can increase VO2Max 5 to 15% on\naverage.&nbsp; Some elite athletes have\nimproved 25% with training.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ventilation does not\nnormally limit VO2Max as indicated by no fall in paO2 (oxygen in the blood)\nduring exercise. &nbsp;Untrained persons\ntypically have a low AT (about 55 % of the VO2 max) while elite endurance\nathletes, at the other end of the spectrum, have a high AT (about 89 to 90 % of\nthe VO2 max). Remember, the maximal heart rate is often closely aligned with\nthe VO2 max (but not always).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This explains why an\nmarathon runner can run very long distances at a high speed for hours: their AT\nthreshold is so high they are able to generate far more power and speed at a\nhigh heart rate only using the aerobic metabolism <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Runners &nbsp;who does not have a high AT threshold could\nnot sustain such a fast pace with a high heart rate without dipping into\nanaerobic metabolism for energy (and thus fatigue in only a couple minutes). &nbsp;Also note they are able to run for long\nperiods of time at their Vo2 Max!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Aerobic pathways are\nused by the muscle cells for energy production (metabolizing both fats and\ncarbohydrates as an energy source) up to exercise levels of approximately 50%\nVO2 max. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Your percentage of VO2\nmax is equal to the proportion of your calories that come from carbohydrates.\nThe rest is fat. So when you run 5k pace (~98-100% VO2 max) you get ~95-100% of\nyour calories from carbohydrates. When you jog very slowly, more than half your\ncalories can come from fat.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In a marathon, at\n~80-85% VO2 max, the typical runner will \"hit the wall\" around\n21-23mi without any external carbohydrate ingestion. At easy to moderate run\npace (55-70% VO2 max) you can last much longer.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fitness can be measured\nby the volume of oxygen you can consume while exercising at your maximum\ncapacity. VO2 max is the maximum amount of oxygen in millilitres, one can use\nin one minute per kilogram of body weight. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Those who are fit have\nhigher VO2 max values and can exercise more intensely than those who are not as\nwell conditioned. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Numerous studies show\nthat you can increase your VO2 max by working out at an intensity that raises\nyour heart rate to between 65 and 85% of its maximum for at least 20 minutes\nthree to five times a week &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A mean value\nof VO2 max for male athletes is about 3.5 litres/minute and for female athletes\nit is about 2.7 litres/minute.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n<br /><b style=\"background-color: red;\"><span style=\"color: yellow;\">Why do we cry 1300 million Indians and not one gold medal ?</span></b></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: x-large; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: red;\"><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: red;\">What are we worth?</b></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: red;\"><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: red;\">Do we have a playground for our school children?</b></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: yellow; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The physical\nlimitations that restrict the rate at which energy can be released aerobically\nare dependent upon:&nbsp;&nbsp; the chemical\nability of the muscular cellular tissue system to use oxygen in breaking down\nfuels and the combined ability of cardiovascular and pulmonary systems to\ntransport the oxygen to the muscular tissue system<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Utilization theory\nmaintains that VO2 max is determined by the body's ability to utilize the\navailable oxygen whereas Presentation Theory maintains it is the ability of the\nbody's cardiovascular system to deliver oxygen to active tissues.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As we get older our VO2\nmax decreases. &nbsp; &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">VO2 max on its own is a\npoor predictor of performance but using the velocity (vVO2 max) and duration\n(tlimvVO2 max) that an athlete can operate at their VO2 max will provide a\nbetter indication of performance.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">VO2 max decreases as\naltitude increases above 1600m and for every 1000m above 1600m maximal oxygen\nuptake decreases by approximately 8-11%. &nbsp;&nbsp;The decrease is mainly due to a decrease in\nmaximal cardiac output (product of heart rate and stroke volume).&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Stoke\nvolume decreases due to the immediate decrease in blood plasma volume.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A large contributing\nfactor to a Kenyan marathon runners VO2 Max score and his lower oxygen\nutilization at lactate threshold has to do with the HIGH altitude at which they\nlive and train.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Running economy is the\nefficiency with which one is able to run i.e. the amount of energy consumed to\ncover a specific distance.. &nbsp;The factors\nthat contribute to running economy are: &nbsp;RUN IN shoes, height, stride length,\nsomatotype, body fat (hip to waist ratio), leg morphology, kinematics, pelvis\nsize and feet size amongst others. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Shoes must have\nearthing at the bottom to dissipate free electrons. This is the first time this\nis being said on this planet.&nbsp; Barefoot\nrunning takes too much of a toll by jarring on hard roads </span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/7dlO5IePx1M/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/7dlO5IePx1M?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">VO2 MAX gives us an\nindication of the potential cardiac output.. &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Your performance in\nendurance sports depends on your ability to consume oxygen at a high rate for a\nsustained period of time.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A high VO2 max is\nnecessary for success in endurance events, but a high VO2 max alone does not\nensure success. &nbsp; &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Currently, sports\nscientists determine performance through lactate thresholds and fractional\nutilisation of VO2 Max.</span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Muscles run on oxygen,\nthat\u2019s one of the reasons trainers used to spend time measuring VO2 max. It\ntold them how much oxygen muscles were receiving and therefore gave them means\nto improve their athletes and reduce muscle fatigue.&nbsp; Better VO2 Max should mean you can more\nefficient send oxygen to the muscles, which means better endurance and speed.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Translated literally, V\nrepresents \u201cvolume\u201d; O2, \u201coxygen\u201d; and max is short for \u201cmaximum.\u201d In other\nwords, the test measures the most oxygen a person can process. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As you stand at rest\nyour body uses ATP (adenosine triphosphate), which is a biochemical your body\nuses to help create energy, just to keep your cells alive. For the average\nperson at rest, they use about 3.5 milliliters of oxygen per kilogram of body\nweight.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But when you exercise, obviously that number goes up because more\nenergy is required, and therefore more oxygen is required to transfer that\nenergy to the systems that need it. The more fit you are, the more oxygen you\nshould be able to use because you\u2019re better able to transfer more energy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is, essentially,\nwhat a VO2 max test measures. The higher your VO2 max, the better shape you\u2019re\nin. For males 18 to 25, the range for above-average VO2 max is between 47 and\n60 mL per kilogram of body weight per minute (mL/kg/min); for women in the same\nage bracket, the range is 42 to 56.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Men\u2019s maxes tend to run higher than women\u2019s\nbecause they have greater body size and, in effect, greater blood volume.\nAverages drop slightly with each successive age group. In general, we peak at\nage 20.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">What accounts for a\nperson\u2019s VO2 max? It\u2019s mostly about the blood, because blood is what transports\noxygen to muscles and organs. The more one has, and the more hemoglobin-packed,\nthe better. Other factors?&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A powerful heart to push all that blood where it\nneeds go, as well as high capillary and mitochondrial density in the muscles.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yoga gives a boost.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">VO2 tests are a way to\nmeasure the maximum volume of oxygen your body can use to make energy. When you\nwork out, your body increases the amount of oxygen it consumes to produce\nenergy (why you breathe harder when running faster) but at some point, your\nbody reaches the maximum rate at which it can consume oxygen and convert it\ninto usable energy.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The most common analogy is to a car engine, the bigger the\nengine, the more potential power it has. When the needle reaches the red zone (\ngear too low ) on your cars tachometer on the dashboard, your car starts to\nmake a little noise and is not happy with you.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Just like when working out past\nyour VO2 max. Your demand for oxygen is higher than your body can supply, which\nis why your body fatigues quicker once above that maximum.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">VO2 max measurement\nthrough a modern metabolic cart during a graded exercise test on a treadmill<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Accurately measuring\nVO2 max involves a physical effort sufficient in duration and intensity to\nfully tax the aerobic energy system.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In general clinical and athletic testing,\nthis usually involves a graded exercise test (either on a treadmill or on a\ncycle ergometer) in which exercise intensity is progressively increased while\nmeasuring:-----</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ventilation and<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">oxygen and carbon\ndioxide concentration of the inhaled and exhaled air.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b>VO2 max is reached when\noxygen consumption remains at a steady state despite an increase in workload.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The factors affecting\nVO2 are often divided into supply and demand. &nbsp;Supply is the transport of oxygen from the\nlungs to the mitochondria (including lung diffusion, stroke volume, blood\nvolume, and capillary density of the skeletal muscle) while demand is the rate\nat which the mitochondria can reduce oxygen in the process of oxidative\nphosphorylation.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Of these, the supply factor is often considered to be the\nlimiting one. However, it has also been argued that while trained subjects\nprobably are supply limited, untrained subjects can indeed have a demand\nlimitation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cardiac output,\npulmonary diffusion capacity, oxygen carrying capacity, and other peripheral\nlimitations like muscle diffusion capacity, mitochondrial enzymes, and\ncapillary density are all examples of VO2 max determinants. The body works as a\nsystem. If one of these factor is sub-par, then the whole system loses its\nnormal capacity to function properly.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If VO2 max is your\naerobic endurance potential then your lactate threshold plays a significant\nrole in how much of that potential you are tapping.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lactate threshold has\nbeen defined as:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The point during\nexercise of increasing intensity at which blood lactate begins to accumulate\nabove resting levels, where lactate clearance is no longer able to keep up with\nlactate production. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During low intensity\nexercise, blood lactate remains at or near to resting levels. As exercise\nintensity increases there comes a break point where blood lactate levels rise\nsharply . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Several terms have been\nused to describe this shift and many coaches and athletes believe it is the\nsame phenomenon:</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lactate threshold</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Anaerobic threshold</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Aerobic threshold</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Onset of blood lactate\naccumulation (OBLA)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Although these terms\nare used interchangeably, they do not describe the same thing. Lactate\naccumulation only determines the balance between lactate production and its\nclearance and suggests nothing about the availability or lack of oxygen so the\nterms aerobic and anaerobic become a bit misleading.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">OBLA generally occurs when\nthe concentration of blood lactate reaches about 4mmol/L (6,7). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maximal lactate steady\nstate is defined as the exercise intensity at which maximal lactate clearance\nis equal to maximal lactate production. Maximal lactate steady state is\nconsidered one of the best indicators of performance perhaps even more\nefficient than lactate threshold .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The lactate threshold\nis normally expressed as a percentage of an individuals VO2 max. For example,\nif VO2 max occurs at 24 km/h on a treadmill test and a sharp rise in blood\nlactate concentration above resting levels is seen at 12 km/h then the lactate threshold\nis said to be 50% VO2 max.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In theory, an\nindividual could exercise at any intensity up to their VO2 max indefinitely.\nHowever, this is not the case even amongst elite athletes. As the exercise\nintensity draws closer to that at VO2 max, a sharp increase in blood lactate\naccumulation and subsequent fatigue occurs the lactate threshold is broken.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In\nworld-class athletes lactate threshold typically occurs at 70-80% VO2 max. In\nuntrained individuals it occurs much sooner, at 50-60% VO2 max <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Generally, in two\npeople with the same VO2 max, the one with a higher lactate threshold will\nperform better in continuous-type endurance events.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-0S1wMzS5T-U/V91SU8pFPKI/AAAAAAABL7s/5PP0a95KtLQz9vTlubZZauwOm7Uem9EMACLcB/s1600/Flt1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"328\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-0S1wMzS5T-U/V91SU8pFPKI/AAAAAAABL7s/5PP0a95KtLQz9vTlubZZauwOm7Uem9EMACLcB/s640/Flt1.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/hwqd13jS5FY/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/hwqd13jS5FY?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/PjtrrIZB9sA/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/PjtrrIZB9sA?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b>Above : My son at Cornell had told me about the sport training programme. &nbsp;They even had a full size stadium . What is our sports minister worth ?</b></span></span>&nbsp;<span style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><b> Imagine Uma Bharti is our water minister. </b></span>.<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">VO2 max is the highest\nat age 20 and decreases nearly 30 percent by age 65.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Because of differences\nin body size and composition, blood volume and hemoglobin content, a woman's\nVO2 max is in general about 20 percent lower than a man's VO2 max.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Because there is less\noxygen at higher altitude an athlete will generally have 5 percent decrease in\nVO2 max results with a 5,000 feet gain in altitude.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">VO2 max results vary\ngreatly. The average for a sedentary individual is close to 35 ml/kg/min. Elite\nendurance athletes often average 70 ml/kg/min.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One of the highest recorded VO2\nmax results (90 ml/kg/min) was that of a cross country skier. Cyclist Lance\nArmstrong's VO2 max was reported at 85 ml/kg/min.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Successful marathon\nrunners will typically have a VO2max more than double that of the average man\nor woman.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Again, maximal oxygen uptake\n(VO2max) refers to an individual\u2019s ability to take large amounts oxygen from\nthe air, transport it to their muscles, and then utilise that oxygen to produce\nenergy in the working muscles.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><br /><br /><br /><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">THIS POST IS NOW CONTINUED TO PART 3 , BELOW-</span></b><br /></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/09/marathon-running-secrets-of_17.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/09/marathon-running-secrets-of_17.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n<br /></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\"><b>BELOW: SPOT \"YOURS TRULY \" -- HAVING A BLAST --ONAM CELEBRATIONS&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; text-decoration: none;\">September 5, 2016 at 4:26 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_14MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nFRANCIS XAVIER WHO SETTLED DOWN IN GOA WAS IMMUNE TO SMALL POX . .<br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\">AS SOON AS THE JESUIT FRANCIS XAVIER CAME TO GOA , HE KILLED MORE THAN 30,000 HINDUS ( MOSTLY ) CHILDREN BY SMALL POX VIRUS -- ADMINISTERED IN TEMPLES .</span></b><br />\n<br />\nHE THEN TOOK A SHIP AND WENT AWAY TO SRI LANKA AND THE FAR EAST.<br />\n<br />\nTHIS CAUSED MOST HINDUS TO RUN AWAY TO MANGALORE AND KERALA IN 1546 AD<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/12/portuguese-inquisition-in-goa-and.html<br />\n<br />\nIT WAS NOT THE BRAVE WHITE MAN -- BULL OF HUNDREDS KILLED MILLIONS OF NATIVES<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/07/fransisco-pizarro-hernan-cortez.html<br />\n<br />\nIT WAS SMALL POX VIRUS . .<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/01/christopher-columbus-father-of-american.html<br />\n<br />\nTHE JESUITS NEVER DID THIS FOUL SMALL POX GENOCIDE ON THE WHITE SKINNED MAN-ONLY BLACK HEATHEN NATIVES NEEDED TO BE EXTERMINATED IF THEY DO NOT AGREE TO BE CONVERTED SLAVES.<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\">HERE IS THE OLD ORIGINAL POST. &nbsp; , serif; font-size: 13pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background: rgb(204, 204, 204); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background: rgb(204, 204, 204); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 13pt;\">Vasco Da Gama tried to\nimpress the King of Calicut with glass beads , scarlet hoods and coral.<br />\n<br />\nOn his second voyage in 1502 Vasco Da Gama came with 25 ships , thousands of\nsoldiers and large canons. Enroute to Calicut they caught a pilgrim ship on\npassage to Mecca and burnt all 700 including women and children alive. He\npounded Calicut city with his long range guns. When a messenger was sent by the\nking, Vasco Da Gama cut off his lips , and ears-- stitched the ears of a dog in\nplace and sent him back.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background: rgb(204, 204, 204); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 13pt;\">King Zamorin was wary of\nthe Portugese and soon they shifted base to Cochin and then to Goa.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background: rgb(204, 204, 204); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 13pt;\"><br />\nPortugese admiral Alfonso De Albuquerque was driven away by the Muslim ruler of\nBijapur and Goa Yusuf Adil Shah. &nbsp;However after 3 months he again\nre-attacked with a larger force, &nbsp;with help from a local Hindu Chieftain\nThimayya.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 13pt;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-pvj1E8snB6Q/V9pU-fC9H6I/AAAAAAABL30/chRFVnTjn2Yo1oT6LIIkecNMxKCuZlYegCLcB/s1600/D.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , serif; font-size: 13pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background: rgb(204, 204, 204); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background: rgb(204, 204, 204); margin-bottom: 13pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 13pt;\">&nbsp;under orders of\nKing of Portugal Joao III.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div align=\"center\" class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background: rgb(204, 204, 204); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TP3efMb07OI/AAAAAAAABgw/SdFmZzem2R0/s1600/7.jpg\"><span style=\"color: #888888; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 13.0pt; text-decoration: none;\"><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id=\"Picture_x0020_153\" o:spid=\"_x0000_i1177\"\n type=\"#_x0000_t75\" alt=\"Description: http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TP3efMb07OI/AAAAAAAABgw/SdFmZzem2R0/s320/7.jpg\"\n href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TP3efMb07OI/AAAAAAAABgw/SdFmZzem2R0/s1600/7.jpg\"\n style='width:174pt;height:240pt;visibility:visible;mso-wrap-style:square'\n o:button=\"t\">\n <v:fill o:detectmouseclick=\"t\"/>\n <v:imagedata src=\"file:///C:\\Users\\win7\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\msohtmlclip1\\01\\clip_image008.jpg\"\n  o:title=\"7\"/>\n</v:shape><![endif]--><!--[if !vml]--><img alt=\"Description: http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TP3efMb07OI/AAAAAAAABgw/SdFmZzem2R0/s320/7.jpg\" border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"file:///C:/Users/win7/AppData/Local/Temp/msohtmlclip1/01/clip_image008.jpg\" v:shapes=\"Picture_x0020_153\" width=\"232\" /><!--[endif]--></span></a><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 13pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background: rgb(204, 204, 204); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background: rgb(204, 204, 204); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 13pt;\">As soon as Xavier landed\nat Goa he wrote to his king \u201c Whoever has seen Goa need not see Lisbon \u201c\u2014and he\ngoes into great lengths to describe the architectural splendor ( Ottoman style\n).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background: rgb(204, 204, 204); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background: rgb(204, 204, 204); margin-bottom: 13pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 13pt;\">Pretty soon, he found\nout the hard way-- that the local Indians are NOT east to convert from Hinduism\nto Christianity. He started by ordering the temples to be demolished. But then\npeople had idols in their houses.<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background: yellow;\">Hinduism was deeprooted. &nbsp;The vedic Indian\ncivilisation flourished on the banks of river Saraswati from 9000 BC to 4000\nBC. When the river Saraswati dried up in 4000 BC , the people had migrated to\nthe Zuari.</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div align=\"center\" class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background: rgb(204, 204, 204); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TP39eujg8xI/AAAAAAAABiQ/4yXi4i8L4Qo/s1600/images+%2823%29.jpg\"><span style=\"color: #888888; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 13.0pt; text-decoration: none;\"><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id=\"Picture_x0020_152\" o:spid=\"_x0000_i1176\"\n type=\"#_x0000_t75\" alt=\"Description: http://1.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TP39eujg8xI/AAAAAAAABiQ/4yXi4i8L4Qo/s1600/images+%252823%2529.jpg\"\n href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TP39eujg8xI/AAAAAAAABiQ/4yXi4i8L4Qo/s1600/images+%2823%29.jpg\"\n style='width:177pt;height:160.5pt;visibility:visible;mso-wrap-style:square'\n o:button=\"t\">\n <v:fill o:detectmouseclick=\"t\"/>\n <v:imagedata src=\"file:///C:\\Users\\win7\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\msohtmlclip1\\01\\clip_image009.jpg\"\n  o:title=\"images+%252823%2529\"/>\n</v:shape><![endif]--><!--[if !vml]--><img alt=\"Description: http://1.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TP39eujg8xI/AAAAAAAABiQ/4yXi4i8L4Qo/s1600/images+%252823%2529.jpg\" border=\"0\" height=\"214\" src=\"file:///C:/Users/win7/AppData/Local/Temp/msohtmlclip1/01/clip_image009.jpg\" v:shapes=\"Picture_x0020_152\" width=\"236\" /><!--[endif]--></span></a><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 13pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background: rgb(204, 204, 204); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background: rgb(204, 204, 204); margin-bottom: 13pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 13pt;\">In 1545 Francis Xavier,\nfrustrated -- wrote to Rome ( this letter is preserved ) and to the King \u2014<br />\n<br />\nQUOTE \u201c The Hindus are an unholy race. They are liars and cheats to the very\nbackbone. Their idols are black\u2014as black as black can be\u2014 ugly and horrible to\nlook at , smeared with oil and smell in a evil manner. \u201c--UNQUOTE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div align=\"center\" class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background: rgb(204, 204, 204); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TP39BmXHh2I/AAAAAAAABiM/Jb22ZRVfYHI/s1600/images+%2822%29.jpg\"><span style=\"color: #888888; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 13.0pt; text-decoration: none;\"><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id=\"Picture_x0020_151\" o:spid=\"_x0000_i1175\"\n type=\"#_x0000_t75\" alt=\"Description: http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TP39BmXHh2I/AAAAAAAABiM/Jb22ZRVfYHI/s1600/images+%252822%2529.jpg\"\n href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TP39BmXHh2I/AAAAAAAABiM/Jb22ZRVfYHI/s1600/images+%2822%29.jpg\"\n style='width:156pt;height:134.25pt;visibility:visible;mso-wrap-style:square'\n o:button=\"t\">\n <v:fill o:detectmouseclick=\"t\"/>\n <v:imagedata src=\"file:///C:\\Users\\win7\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\msohtmlclip1\\01\\clip_image010.jpg\"\n  o:title=\"images+%252822%2529\"/>\n</v:shape><![endif]--><!--[if !vml]--><img alt=\"Description: http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TP39BmXHh2I/AAAAAAAABiM/Jb22ZRVfYHI/s1600/images+%252822%2529.jpg\" border=\"0\" height=\"179\" src=\"file:///C:/Users/win7/AppData/Local/Temp/msohtmlclip1/01/clip_image010.jpg\" v:shapes=\"Picture_x0020_151\" width=\"208\" /><!--[endif]--></span></a><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 13pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background: rgb(204, 204, 204); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div align=\"center\" class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background: rgb(204, 204, 204); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TP38jSV6a2I/AAAAAAAABiI/seZpNG8zpyE/s1600/images+%2821%29.jpg\"><span style=\"color: #888888; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 13.0pt; text-decoration: none;\"><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id=\"Picture_x0020_150\" o:spid=\"_x0000_i1174\"\n type=\"#_x0000_t75\" alt=\"Description: http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TP38jSV6a2I/AAAAAAAABiI/seZpNG8zpyE/s1600/images+%252821%2529.jpg\"\n href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TP38jSV6a2I/AAAAAAAABiI/seZpNG8zpyE/s1600/images+%2821%29.jpg\"\n style='width:194.25pt;height:145.5pt;visibility:visible;mso-wrap-style:square'\n o:button=\"t\">\n <v:fill o:detectmouseclick=\"t\"/>\n <v:imagedata src=\"file:///C:\\Users\\win7\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\msohtmlclip1\\01\\clip_image011.jpg\"\n  o:title=\"images+%252821%2529\"/>\n</v:shape><![endif]--><!--[if !vml]--><img alt=\"Description: http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TP38jSV6a2I/AAAAAAAABiI/seZpNG8zpyE/s1600/images+%252821%2529.jpg\" border=\"0\" height=\"194\" src=\"file:///C:/Users/win7/AppData/Local/Temp/msohtmlclip1/01/clip_image011.jpg\" v:shapes=\"Picture_x0020_150\" width=\"259\" /><!--[endif]--></span></a><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 13pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background: rgb(204, 204, 204); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background: rgb(204, 204, 204); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 13pt;\">He then formally ordered\nthe Portugese Inquisition fo Goa , which ran from 1516 to 1812. The rest of\nEurope had terminated the Inquisition in 1774. It stopped in 1812 due to\nBritish intervention.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background: rgb(204, 204, 204); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background: rgb(204, 204, 204); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 13pt;\">More than 20000 people\nwere brought under trial by this Inquisition.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background: rgb(204, 204, 204); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background: rgb(204, 204, 204); margin-bottom: 13pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 13pt;\">The Portugese first\nstarted off with high ranking Saraswat Brahmin Hindus who held the land and\nriches. Who ever was caught in a palanquin had to undergo the brutal\ninquisition.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div align=\"center\" class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background: rgb(204, 204, 204); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TP3ej6zwReI/AAAAAAAABg0/-iKslIGsPto/s1600/8.jpg\"><span style=\"color: #888888; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 13.0pt; text-decoration: none;\"><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id=\"Picture_x0020_149\" o:spid=\"_x0000_i1173\"\n type=\"#_x0000_t75\" alt=\"Description: http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TP3ej6zwReI/AAAAAAAABg0/-iKslIGsPto/s320/8.jpg\"\n href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TP3ej6zwReI/AAAAAAAABg0/-iKslIGsPto/s1600/8.jpg\"\n style='width:240pt;height:104.25pt;visibility:visible;mso-wrap-style:square'\n o:button=\"t\">\n <v:fill o:detectmouseclick=\"t\"/>\n <v:imagedata src=\"file:///C:\\Users\\win7\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\msohtmlclip1\\01\\clip_image012.jpg\"\n  o:title=\"8\"/>\n</v:shape><![endif]--><!--[if !vml]--><img alt=\"Description: http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TP3ej6zwReI/AAAAAAAABg0/-iKslIGsPto/s320/8.jpg\" border=\"0\" height=\"139\" src=\"file:///C:/Users/win7/AppData/Local/Temp/msohtmlclip1/01/clip_image012.jpg\" v:shapes=\"Picture_x0020_149\" width=\"320\" /><!--[endif]--></span></a><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 13pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background: rgb(204, 204, 204); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background: rgb(204, 204, 204); margin-bottom: 13pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 13pt;\">They were NOT allowed to\nwear the Shendi ( hair tuft ), have a Tulsi plant in front of their house, wear\nthe sacred thread , have an idol in their homes , wear sandals , read the Vedas\netc<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div align=\"center\" class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background: rgb(204, 204, 204); margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TP3iEGYT_fI/AAAAAAAABh4/57VSoSrhJts/s1600/images+%283%29.jpg\"><span style=\"color: #888888; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
