On arrival at the medical tent, blood samples were immediately &nbsp;collected from all the subjects.<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\nThese samples were analysed for haemoglobin concentration, packed\ncell volume, plasma proteins, serum sodium, serum potassium, serum total\ncalcium, serum total magnesium, serum osmolality, and plasma glucose.\nThereafter subjects were weighed in full race attire (running shorts, vest, and\nshoes) as before the race. <o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Practice your electrolyte replacement in training, this is\nthe responsibility of the coach. <o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">If the runner has to compete in a hot place, train in a hot\nplace.&nbsp; &nbsp;In OP Jaisha\u2019s case the coach from Belarus\nwanted to stay in cold place ( Kodaikanal for his own personal comfort )</b></span><o:p></o:p></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The fluid in body cells\nis high in potassium; 90% of the body's potassium is inside the cells. Other\nbody fluids are high in sodium.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Fluid&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Sodium Content&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Potassium Content</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Blood&nbsp; &nbsp;3,100 - 3,330 mg/L&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 137 - 200 mg/L<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sweat&nbsp; &nbsp;575 - 1,725 mg/L&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 155 - 200 mg/L<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As I said , the major\nroute for sodium loss is sweat. Because potassium is held inside the cells, it\nis not lost at high rates provided there is adequate sodium in the body.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-X0brNAnxpYo/V9rZ6rJu-hI/AAAAAAABL44/IXOUHzvXP7A7sWAYo5WSG7WkaAThVfb6gCLcB/s1600/im222ages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"478\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-X0brNAnxpYo/V9rZ6rJu-hI/AAAAAAABL44/IXOUHzvXP7A7sWAYo5WSG7WkaAThVfb6gCLcB/s640/im222ages.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Normal sweat rates can\nrange from 0.75 to 2 Liters/ hour, depending on conditions such as temperature,\nhumidity, pace, clothing, and the degree of heat acclimation the runner&nbsp; has. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: red;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A typical electrolyte\nloss rates by sweat are 1,300 mg/hr for sodium, and 230 mg/hr for potassium.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many athletes, marathon\nrunners , will drink too little water and suffer dehydration. The athlete's\nbody usually cannot absorb water from the stomach as fast as it is sweated out\nof the skin, so most of them end up with some dehydration in an event.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As sodium levels fall, the body increases the\nlevel of the hormone aldosterone that influences kidney function to slow sodium\nloss. As exercise continues and sodium is lost, blood pressure may fall.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nbody produces the hormone vasopressin to help maintain blood pressure. If\nexercise continues, with more water and electrolyte losses, performance begins\nto suffer and athletes slow down. S<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As the level of sodium\nin the blood decreases, the ratio of sodium to water decreases to dangerous\nlevels. As a defense mechanism, water will be moved from the blood into the\nspaces around body cells. That is why hands and feet can swell after many hours\nof competing<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-1CnrPhk6gtM/V9rbs8hXMGI/AAAAAAABL5A/tr5SrGT3rEkaYl4sFUEFbc4vvZLF5b1AQCLcB/s1600/dowrnload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"479\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-1CnrPhk6gtM/V9rbs8hXMGI/AAAAAAABL5A/tr5SrGT3rEkaYl4sFUEFbc4vvZLF5b1AQCLcB/s640/dowrnload.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You can reduce the\namount of sodium in your daily food. That will increase the level of\naldosterone so that your body retains sodium better. Choose less salty foods.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ensuring adequate\ndietary intake of the electrolyte minerals \u2013 sodium and potassium because\nthey\u2019re involved in conducting electrical signals to/from muscles, and calcium\nand magnesium, which are essential for the contraction and relaxation of muscle\nfibres.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-r1AqtMDr-Uk/V9rcK7Slh0I/AAAAAAABL5E/ETDIlu7GT_oEHg9u-DTIicetOyQALNADgCLcB/s1600/down56hload.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"299\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-r1AqtMDr-Uk/V9rcK7Slh0I/AAAAAAABL5E/ETDIlu7GT_oEHg9u-DTIicetOyQALNADgCLcB/s400/down56hload.png\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"color: red;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many athletes, marathon\nrunners , will drink too little water and suffer dehydration. The athlete's\nbody usually cannot absorb water from the stomach as fast as it is sweated out\nof the skin, so most of them end up with some dehydration in an event.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As sodium levels fall, the body increases the\nlevel of the hormone aldosterone that influences kidney function to slow sodium\nloss. As exercise continues and sodium is lost, blood pressure may fall. The\nbody produces the hormone vasopressin to help maintain blood pressure. If\nexercise continues, with more water and electrolyte losses, performance begins\nto suffer and athletes slow down. S<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As the level of sodium\nin the blood decreases, the ratio of sodium to water decreases to dangerous\nlevels. As a defense mechanism, water will be moved from the blood into the\nspaces around body cells. That is why hands and feet can swell after many hours\nof competing<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You can reduce the\namount of sodium in your daily food. That will increase the level of\naldosterone so that your body retains sodium better. Choose less salty foods.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ensuring adequate\ndietary intake of the electrolyte minerals \u2013 sodium and potassium because\nthey\u2019re involved in conducting electrical signals to/from muscles, and calcium\nand magnesium, which are essential for the contraction and relaxation of muscle\nfibres.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even just 2% of fluid\nlost from your total body weight can make it much harder to perform.&nbsp; It\u2019s not just water that\u2019s lost, it\u2019s fluid\nwhich contains sodium, electrolytes and minerals which means that plain old\nwater is not enough for runners.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is a good idea to\ndetermine what you need for your own healthy running performance and devise\nyour own hydration plan. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THIS IS THE JOB OF THE\nCOACH<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-oWftBWkLInM/V9rdtTUzc0I/AAAAAAABL5I/h1zpl2I2M_0VX9h_jaNfHw73yfiRk_MuwCLcB/s1600/odrs.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-oWftBWkLInM/V9rdtTUzc0I/AAAAAAABL5I/h1zpl2I2M_0VX9h_jaNfHw73yfiRk_MuwCLcB/s640/odrs.jpg\" width=\"524\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One ORS packet mixed\nwith a liter/quart, contains (1g = 1,000mg):<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sodium Chloride - 3.5g\n(3500mg)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Potassium Chloride -\n1.5g (1500mg)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Trisodium Citrate ,\ndihydrate - 2.9g (2900mg)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dextrose Anhydrous -\n20.0g (20,000mg)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Again, the average loss\nof salt in sweat is approximately 1g per litre.&nbsp;\n&nbsp;If you eat too may salty potato\nchips, your body generates thirst and you will drink water and stop as soon as\nyour feel the thirst is gone. This is the wonder of the human body<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-h87f3RXciRA/V9rfp5LkzEI/AAAAAAABL5M/DaAaf1EZd-UE92i3ueRQ-eJhiKS19qMEwCLcB/s1600/hith-women-childree3en-first-E.jpeg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"358\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-h87f3RXciRA/V9rfp5LkzEI/AAAAAAABL5M/DaAaf1EZd-UE92i3ueRQ-eJhiKS19qMEwCLcB/s640/hith-women-childree3en-first-E.jpeg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When ships sink sailors\ndo NOT drink sea water.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the salt concentration is higher on the outside of\nour cells than on the inside, water moves from the inside to the outside of the\ncells to correct the imbalance. The attempt to equalize the concentrations of\nmatter on both sides of a semipermeable membrane is called osmosis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If you're consuming\nseawater, the results of osmosis are spectacularly disastrous. Remember the\nsalinity of seawater is almost four times that of our bodily fluids. If gone\nunchecked, the net transfer of water from the inside of your cells to the\noutside will cause the cells to shrink considerably -- and shrinkage is never\ngood.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unless you drink a lot\nof freshwater, the body's regulatory mechanism in this situation is potentially\nfatal. With seawater, the change in sodium concentration outside our cells is\nthe main culprit.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In order to regain an isotonic state, a must for cell\nsurvival, the body attempts to eliminate the excess sodium from its\nextracellular fluids. It secretes urine.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However, human kidneys can only\nproduce urine that's slightly less salty than saltwater. So, in order to remove\nthe extreme amount of sodium taken in by saltwater, we urinate more water than\nwe actually drank. And dehydration sets in.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So, if you're guzzling\nseawater, you actually aren't taking in any water but are incurring a net loss,\nleading to depleted body fluids, muscle cramps, dry mouth, and yes, thirst.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The body tries to\ncompensate for fluid loss by increasing the heart rate and constricting blood\nvessels to maintain blood pressure and flow to vital organs. You're also most\nlikely to feel nausea, weakness and even delirium.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As you become more\ndehydrated, the coping mechanism fails. If you still don't drink any water to\nreverse the effects of excess sodium, the brain and other organs receive less blood,\nleading to coma, organ failure and eventually death.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Of course, consuming\nsmall amounts of saltwater won't kill you. The take home message is clear,\nthough: Salt and water are best consumed separately -- and any salt intake\nshould be accompanied by plenty of freshwater.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Generally the\nwell-conditioned athlete loses less sodium than a poorly conditioned athlete<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hyponatremia, is\ndefined by plasma concentration below 135 mM sodium--&nbsp; can exist either due to reduced levels of\nsodium in a normal blood volume or by normal sodium levels in an increased\nplasma volume<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hypernatremia is\ndefined by plasma concentration above 145 mM sodium-- can be caused by either\nincreased levels of sodium in normal blood volume or normal sodium content in\nreduced plasma volume.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dehydration is the loss\nof plasma volume (blood) due to sweating, urine and exhalation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The bulk of active\nsodium ions are stored and available in blood plasma. No immediately-available\nrepository of sodium has yet been reported discovered in any tissue or organ\nwithin the body to date.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sodium enables ATP\n(energy) generation and also allows cells to retain more water, thereby helping\nto prevent dehydration&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Because fluid\nbalance is intimately tied to sodium, hyponatremia can lead to damage of\ncertain kinds of tissues in your body. Changes are most noticeable in the\nnervous system, where seizures, coma, and even death can result.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Water is a basic need\nfor cellular health. Cells contain water and are surrounded by water. In\ndehydration, cell membranes become less permeable, hampering the flow of\nhormones and nutrients into the cell and preventing waste products that cause\ncell damage from flowing out.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Again, extracellular\nfluid is lost through sweat<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Extracellular fluid &nbsp;differs from intracellular fluid (fluid within\nthe cells) in that it generally has a high concentration of sodium and low\nconcentration of potassium, while intracellular fluid is high in potassium and\nlow in sodium.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In humans, the normal\nglucose concentration of extracellular fluid that is regulated by homeostasis\nis approximately 5 mM, and the pH is tightly regulated by buffers around 7.4.\nThe volume of ECF is typically 15 L, of which 12 L is interstitial fluid and 3\nL is plasma.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Interstitial fluid makes up 16% of human body weight, and blood\nplasma, 4%. Extracellular fluid, in conjunction with intracellular fluid, helps\ncontrol the movement of water and electrolytes throughout the body.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Homeostasis refers to\nthe maintenance of the internal environment of the body within narrow and\nrigidly controlled limits. The major functions important in the maintenance of\nhomeostasis are fluid and electrolyte balance, acid-base regulation,\nthermoregulation, and metabolic control.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The human body is\nbasically a collection of cells grouped together into organ systems and bathed\nin fluids, most notably the blood. The intracellular fluid is the fluid\ncontained within cells. The extracellular fluid\u2014the fluid outside the cells\u2014is\ndivided into that found within the blood and that found outside the blood; the\nlatter fluid is known as the interstitial fluid.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These fluids are not simply\nwater but contain varying amounts of solutes (electrolytes and other bioactive\nmolecules). An electrolyte (sodium chloride, for example) is defined as any\nmolecule that in solution separates into its ionic components and is capable of\nconducting an electric current. Cations are electrolytes that migrate toward\nthe negative pole of an electric field; anions migrate toward the positive\npole.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The major cation of extracellular fluid is sodium. The major anion of the\nextracellular fluid is chloride, while bicarbonate is the second most\nimportant. In contrast, the major cation of the intracellular fluid is\npotassium, and the major anions are proteins and organic phosphates.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The marked\ndifferences in sodium and potassium concentrations between the intracellular\nand extracellular fluid of cells are not fortuitous but are due to active\ntransport by energy-dependent ion pumps located in cell membranes.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The pumps\ncontinuously move sodium ions out of the cell and potassium ions into the cell.\nThe intracellular and extracellular compartments are thus closely integrated\nand interdependent: changes in one have immediate effects on the other.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is the primary task\nof the kidneys to regulate the various ionic concentrations of the body. Any\nabnormality in these concentrations can produce serious disease; for instance,\nthe normal sodium concentration in the serum (the blood minus its cells and\nclotting factors) ranges from 136 to 142 milliequivalents per litre, while the\nnormal potassium level in the serum is kept within the narrow range of 3.5 to 5\nmilliequivalents per litre.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A rise in the serum potassium to perhaps 6.2\nmilliequivalents per litre, as can occur when large numbers of cells are\nseverely injured or die and potassium ions are released, could cause serious\nabnormalities in the performance of the heart by disturbing the regularity of the\nnervous impulses that maintain the heart\u2019s rhythm.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The total amount of\nbody water is also maintained at fairly constant levels from day to day by the\ncombined action of the central nervous system and the kidneys. If one were to\nrefrain from drinking any water for a few days, the thirst centre, located in\nthe hypothalamus deep within the brain, would send out messages that would be\ntranslated into the feeling of thirst.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At the same time a hormone from the\nposterior pituitary gland known as antidiuretic hormone (ADH; vasopressin)\nwould be secreted. This hormone, released into the bloodstream, would reach the\nkidneys, where it would signal the kidneys to retain water and not excrete it.\nShould too much water be ingested, ADH secretion would be turned off, and the\nkidneys would promptly excrete the excess amount.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: red;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\">\n\n\n\n</span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Potassium is a mineral\nand is responsible for regulating total body water and stabilizing contractions\n(both controlled and automatic). A deficiency of potassium (hypokalemia) can\nmanifest as weakness, fatigue, confusion, heart irregularities, and sometimes\ncause problems in muscular coordination.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Insufficient potassium can also\nexaggerate the effects of a lack of available sodium. The first sign of a\npotassium deficiency is usually a generalized weakness - not something you wish\nto experience during an Ironman or marathon. Endurance athletes have higher\npotassium needs due to heavier sweat loss; in a study of athletes running 40\nminutes at 21 deg C , potassium loss was estimated at 435 mg/hour.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Based on this\nrate of potassium loss, supplementation both during and after short and long\nevents is warranted and necessary. Sweat contains approximately 2 grams of\nsodium/liter, 1 gram chloride/liter, 0.2 gram potassium /liter, and 0.1 gram\nmagnesium/liter.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the blood has too\nmuch water and too little sodium, brain cells absorb too much water, which\ncauses the brain to swell and the tissue to push against the skull and\nsometimes down the brain stem. It can lead to nausea, fatigue, vomiting and, in\nthe most severe instances, seizures, coma and even death.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Carbohydrate, which\nprovides fuel for working muscles, and sodium, which helps to maintain fluid\nbalance.&nbsp; A sports drink should also\ncontain approximately 50mg of sodium per 100ml, along with smaller amounts of the\nother electrolytes, such as potassium and chloride, which are lost in sweat.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><b><br /></b></span><br />\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_64M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/09/portuguese-inquisition-is-goa-by-jesuit.html?showComment=1474003420240#c1982015691009838915\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration: none;\">September 16, 2016 at 10:53 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_64MC\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 22.4px; margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhttps://sputniknews.com/military/20160915/1045347626/india-russ-a-yasen-submarine.html<br />\n<br />\nIN CASE OF EMP ATTACK<br />\n<br />\nA SUBMARINE SHOULD BE ABLE TO POWER UP COASTAL MILITARY FACILITIES FROM UNDERWATER.<br />\n<br />\nINDIA IS A PENINSULA . .<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/11/world-war-3-sans-gps-and-emp-taken-out.html<br />\n<br />\nMOST OF OUR ARMED FORCES BIG BRASS <b><span style=\"color: blue;\">ARE LIKE OP JAISHAs FOREIGN COACH . . IF YOU ASK THIS MAN WHAT IS SODIUM, HE WILL SCRATCH HIS HEAD.&nbsp;</span></b><br />\n<br />\nSAME WAY ASK THESE UNIFORMED PEACOCKS , WHAT IS EMP--THEY WILL SCRATCH THEIR BALLS. ( i have already tried it with retired big brass of army/ navy / airforce )<br />\n<br />\nWHY DOES A BLOGGER NEED TO WRITE ALL THIS<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"></span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Potassium ions played a\ncritical role in the development of a functional cellular world. Unlike sodium\nand calcium ions, they do not carry thermodynamically-structured water molecules\nwith them - they move rapidly, breaking up coordinated clusters and increasing\nthe freedom of water so it can assume kinetically-produced linear\nconfigurations adjacent to surfaces \u2013 it penetrates cavities in proteins to\nrelax and form transient bridges between polar and ionic atoms. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sodium ions, on the\nother hand, dehydrate proteins - they draw water away from surfaces to form\ntheir own thermodynamic spheres of hydration. In fact, it was this fundamental\ndifference in hydration properties between sodium and potassium ions which\nprovided a mechanism for the development of living cells.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: red;\">\n\n\n\n<b><br /></b></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Magnesium is the fourth\nmost abundant element (behind sodium, potassium and calcium) found in your\nbody, with a total of 50 to 60 percent being stored in your skeletal system and\nthe remainder being stored in muscles and soft tissues,.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Magnesium plays an\ninstrumental role in maintaining both structural (bone) and biochemical (muscle\ncontraction, nerve transmission, enzyme production) homeostasis within your\nbody. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In fact, magnesium is\nresponsible for 80 percent of all enzymatic reactions in the body, regulating\nvirtually every body activity. Because of these established roles, attainment\nand maintenance of magnesium balance is crucial for optimal health and peak\nphysical performance.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Under normal\nconditions, the water and electrolyte content of the body is regulated by the\nkidneys, the secretion of antidiuretic hormone, and the sensation of thirst.\nThe average adult needs to take in about 700-800 mL of water per day in order\nto match the water lost through perspiration, breathing, and excretion of waste\nproducts. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Exercise raises the\ntotal metabolism of the body to 5-15 times the resting rate. Most of this\nenergy (70-90 percent) is released as heat, which is partially dissipated by\nthe evaporation of sweat.&nbsp;&nbsp; Sweat,\nhowever, contains sodium chloride as well as smaller amounts of potassium,\ncalcium, and magnesium.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cation&nbsp; is an ion carrying a positive charge due to a\nloss of electrons. Cations in the body include sodium, potassium, magnesium,\nand calcium ions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sodium teams with\npotassium, the chief cation of intracellular fluid, to maintain proper body\nfluid and acid-base balance in the cells and tissue and maintain blood\npressure. Potassium and other electrolytes\u2014such as magnesium and\nchloride\u2014perform numerous, multifaceted roles in the body. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They work in concert\nwith sodium to regulate acid-base, electrolyte, and water balance; conduct\nnerve impulses; promote normal muscle contraction (including the heartbeat);\nregulate the transfer of nutrients to cells; and maintain the normal function\nof the kidneys, heart, and nerve cells. An imbalance of any electrolyte can\nhave far-reaching, serious effects within the body<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\">Additional\ncomplications arising from supplementing with sodium alone are imbalanced\nelectrolyte levels.&nbsp; Increased sodium can\nnegatively affect potassium and magnesium levels, which, consequently, could\nreduce exercise performance and contribute to cramping.</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span><span style=\"color: red;\"><b><span style=\"font-size: large;\">THIS POST IS NOW CONTINUED TO PART 2, BELOW</span></b></span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/09/marathon-running-secrets-of_16.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/09/marathon-running-secrets-of_16.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"></span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><b><br /></b></span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-LB56bZWXOdM/V9lkeSK1ixI/AAAAAAABL1w/4V2QUpcbHqseqW5OAK2EmYXX9ML7iuFUgCLcB/s1600/20140919_070030.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-LB56bZWXOdM/V9lkeSK1ixI/AAAAAAABL1w/4V2QUpcbHqseqW5OAK2EmYXX9ML7iuFUgCLcB/s640/20140919_070030.jpg\" width=\"564\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\nCAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL<br />\n<br />\n<br /></div>\n", "author": {"id": "14410812789424637654", "displayName": "Capt. Ajit Vadakayil", "url": "https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654", "image": {"url": "//4.bp.blogspot.com/-QSnd-Z8F7Kc/XFtPudWdwlI/AAAAAAABfq4/vxrkFOO7Iu8Mf6-OaPgw6FPpRDSmMgLdgCK4BGAYYCw/s35/capt%25252BajitC%25252Bvadakayil.JPG"}}, "replies": {"totalItems": "76", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/6070638722520778358/comments"}}, {"kind": "blogger#post", "id": "5648661007706842939", "blog": {"id": "3564735312144269387"}, "published": "2016-09-11T19:18:00+05:30", "updated": "2018-12-29T14:31:43+05:30", "etag": "\"iHf3yWDE_geBgZ8U7rgZ_xuTeAQ/dGltZXN0YW1wOiAxNTQ2MDc0MTAzMDY3Cm9mZnNldDogMTk4MDAwMDAK\"", "url": "http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/09/communist-maoist-naxalite-movements-in_11.html", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/5648661007706842939", "title": "COMMUNIST , MAOIST , NAXALITE MOVEMENTS IN INDIA EXHUMED , PART 8 - CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL", "content": "<div dir=\"ltr\" style=\"text-align: left;\" trbidi=\"on\">\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">THIS POST IS CONTINUED FROM PART 7, BELOW--</span></b><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/09/communist-maoist-naxalite-movements-in_9.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/09/communist-maoist-naxalite-movements-in_9.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">TISS has churned out\nMarxist thinkers even before Independence.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Tata Institute of\nSocial Sciences (TISS) is a social sciences institute in Mumbai, &nbsp;was created by an agents of Jew Rothschild in\n1936.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SIR Dorabji Tata was the son of Rothschild\u2019s Opium drug running partner J#msetji\nNusserw#nji T#ta.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;TISS was established in 1936, as the Sir Dorabji Tata\nGraduate School of Social Work, the first school of social work in India. It\nwas renamed to its current name in 1944.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rotshchild\u2019s agent &nbsp;a crypto Jew Jew missionary &nbsp;Clifford Manshardt came to TISS to establish\nthe commie syllabus and ideology. &nbsp;There\nare four campuses of TISS running currently, located at Mumbai, Tuljapur,\nHyderabad and Guwahati.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHILE JNU HAS BEEN\nCAUGHT WITH THEIR PANTS DOWN FOR BEING A COMMIE DEN, TISS WITH THE HELP OF\nROTHSCHILDs MEDIA HAS PRESERVES A SQUEAKY CLEAN REPUTATION. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BUT EX-TISS SOCIAL\nSCIENCE STUDENTS/ PROFESSORS &nbsp;WILL\nWHISPER THAT TISS IS A BIGGER ANTI-WATAN SPAWNER THAN JNU / JU/ DU/ FTII.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">AVBP had openly\ndeclared in Feb 2016 \u201cOur next stop will be Tata Institute of Social Sciences\nin Mumbai. It is an even bigger hub of Maoists than the JNU.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\">TISS students played a\nmajor role in organising one of the biggest rallies Mumbai has seen in the past\nfew years, demanding justice for Dalit research scholar Rohith Vemula, who\nkilled himself on the Hyderabad Central University campus in January.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Mumbai rally was a\nsea of red and blue flags, with supporters of the CPI(M) and Bharipa Bahujan\nMahasangh, a political party headed by Prakash Ambedkar, turning out in large\nnumbers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Prime Minister's\nRural Development Fellows Scheme (PMRDFs) is an initiative of the Ministry of\nRural Development (MoRD), Government of India (GoI), implemented in\ncollaboration with State Governments. The focus of the programme is on\nreduction of poverty and improving the lives of the population in backward and\nisolated regions of India.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"300\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-nQ_tnRqdpLo/V9VxqeQgUmI/AAAAAAABLxI/CSGcXBJ3PaUk2LArRKZqlRdt2cbjeO3jACLcB/s640/imagQ34es.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Maoists have now\nacquired tactical know-how . They have&nbsp;\nimproved their technical capabilities considerably.&nbsp; This means it is NOT a mere local tribal\nshow.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The PLGA consists of\narmed cadres dressed in military green uniforms.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They are the main\nattack force of the Maoists and&nbsp; have a\nformidable armoury of weapons at their disposal. Some of them being the INSAS\nrifle, SLR, AK-47, country made rockets, IEDs, claymore mines, timer devices\netc. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They have sophisticated\nChinese rocket launchers. The weapons used by the Maoists are mainly those that\nare looted from police or paramilitary forces. This remains the easiest source\nof weaponry for the Maoists. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Maoists have also\nbeen able to procure high grade weapons from illegal arms markets in Bangladesh\nand Myanmar as well. Explosives form an integral part of the Maoist weaponry\nand are often used to blow up physical infrastructure of the State.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In an attack on the\nNational Mineral Development Corporation (NDMC) in February, 2005, the Maoists\nlooted about 50 tonnes of ammonium nitrate, a key explosive used for detonating\niron ore mines by mining contractors. This was an inside job,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maoists employ IT\nexperts, who help them in development of explosives and other weapons. These\nexperts also play a significant role in communications and tapping government\ninformation, while also designing war&nbsp;\nstrategies and guerilla warfare plans.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to the\nInstitute of Conflict Management, the Maoists have been successful in\nmanufacturing claymore mines and detonating them from remote controlled devices\nfrom a far off distance, making use of Icom-V8 wireless sets.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Not only do the mines give the Maoists\nconsiderable advantage in the warzone, the Maoists have used them judiciously\nto ambush security personnel in large numbers as was seen in Dantewada in 2009.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">According to &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">Chhattisgarh DGP Vishwa\nRanjan, \u201cBastar region is spread over nearly 40,000 sq km, of which up to\n25,000 sq km is intensively mined.\u201d</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\">These\nare the foreign controlled poisonous snakes our Collegium Judiciary , NHRC, NCM\nand foreign payroll Rajya Sbha members support .</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Small contingents of\nsecurity personnel are targeted by mines embedded deep under the roads. For\nlarge security contingents, the Maoist use landmines as a \u201cfirst shock\u201d, before\nengaging the security forces in a gun-battle. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Maoists bury these\nmines deep under metalled roads at the time of construction. By threatening\nlocal contractors, the Maoists are able to fulfill this objective.<span style=\"background: yellow; mso-highlight: yellow;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The biggest challenge\nfor the security forces in the Red Corridor comes from Improvised Explosive\nDevices (IED). Maoists have preferred the IED option in the Red Corridor, which\nin the last five years claimed the lives of more than 320 Central Reserve\nPolice Force (CRPF) personnel.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mine Protected Vehicles (MPV), which were\nsupposed to protect security personnel from IED blasts, have themselves become\na reason for higher casualties.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The existing MPVs with\nthe CRPF are not designed to sustain the intensity of IED blasts.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">High\ndetonation velocity explosives, like RDX, shatter the metallic hull of the MPV\nwhereas the low detonator velocity explosives (used by Naxals) tend to topple\nit. The casualties took place because the vehicle itself topples during IED\nblast.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The CRPF must acquire MPVs that can sustain high detonation velocities.</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To\nensure better protection, the mine resistant ambush protection (MRAP) vehicles\nare designed to have V-shaped underbellies to deflect blasts outwards, which in\nturn give less shockwaves to the troops inside the vehicle.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The new generation\nMRAPs weigh much less compared to the previous version as they are made from\nlighter and stronger steel. These vehicles also featured suspended seats to\nprotect riders from shock waves emanating from the blasts below.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So,\nessentially this modified MRAP gives better protection from blasts, with much\nreduced weight, more effective V-shaped underbelly and the removed crew pod. As\na preventive measure, the American forces fitted their vehicles (used in\ncounter IED operations) with extra wheels in the front which triggered the\nexplosions much before the vehicle comes directly under the blast.<span style=\"background: yellow; mso-highlight: yellow;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since 2010, the\nCRPF-the principal counter-Maoist force of the country-has lost nearly a 100\nmen to IEDs, with another 274 injured. The force has also recovered a\nstaggering 57 tonnes of explosive material in the same period. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Last year, they\nrecovered explosives in record numbers-1,702 IEDs and 20,781 detonators.</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Existing\nMPVs produced by the OFB can withstand a blast of 10 kgs of TNT under the\nwheels and 14 kgs under the hull. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Maoists realised\nthis chink in their armour as far back as 2005. Since then, a wave of Maoist\nIED attacks, some using the equivalent of 50 and even 80 kg TNT, targeted MPVs.\nIn several cases, troopers were killed because they sustained grievous injuries\nafter being flung about inside the vehicle during the blast. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The most horrific\nattack in Dantewada district happened in September '05, killing 23 policeman\nand a civilian. The IED blast tossed the MPV some 20 feet in the air.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nthreat from high intensity IEDs remains. Last September, the CRPF unearthed a\n50 kg IED buried on a road in Chhattisgarh's Narayanpur district.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An IAF Mi-17 transport\nhelicopter was shot down in Chhattisgarh's Sukma region on January 17, '13. The\npilot crashlanded the machine in the fields of Temilwada, a Maoist 'liberated\nzone'. A lone MPV of the CRPF which reached the spot, evacuated the injured\ncrew, brought in logistics, ferried senior officers and, most importantly,\nacted as a mobile, bullet- and landmine-proof guard post. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-HKAS9ehlkIo/V9WCrwqvfRI/AAAAAAABLxY/yT0yRt15qyonZJgnmSiHqx4u-dVmQje9gCLcB/s1600/ScreenNshot_5-49.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"364\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-HKAS9ehlkIo/V9WCrwqvfRI/AAAAAAABLxY/yT0yRt15qyonZJgnmSiHqx4u-dVmQje9gCLcB/s640/ScreenNshot_5-49.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>WE KNOW WHY OUR\nCOLLEGIUM JUDICIARY , NHRC , NCM PROTECTS THESE MAOIST BASTARDS&nbsp; . . <o:p></o:p></b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>OUR CONSTITUTION PROTECTS ONLY LAW ABIDING CITIZENS -NOT FOREIGN ARMED TRAITORS. .</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>WE KNOW WHO THE\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">TRAITORS FROM WITHIN</span> ARE\u2014</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
